ankle: (in humans) the joint between the foot and the leg, in which movement occurs in two planes.
joint: the place at which two things, or separate parts of one thing, are joined or united, either rigidly or in such a way as to permit motion; juncture.
everlasting: lasting forever; eternal: everlasting future life.
enclose: to shut or hem in; close in on all sides: a valley enclosed by tall mountains.
secret: done, made, or conducted without the knowledge of others: secret negotiations.
scheme: a plan, design, or program of action to be followed; project.
overthrow: to depose, as from a position of power; overcome, defeat, or vanquish: to overthrow a tyrant.
user: a person or thing that uses.
interface: a surface regarded as the common boundary of two bodies, spaces, or phases.
amusing: pleasantly entertaining or diverting: an amusing speaker.
exciting: producing excitement; stirring; thrilling: an exciting account of his trip to Tibet.
cultural: of or relating to culture or cultivation.
historical: of, pertaining to, treating, or characteristic of history or past events: historical records; historical research.
heritage: something that comes or belongs to one by reason of birth; an inherited lot or portion: a heritage of poverty and suffering; a national heritage of honor, pride, and courage.
obnoxious: highly objectionable or offensive; odious: obnoxious behavior.
annoying: causing annoyance; irritatingly bothersome: annoying delays.
monthly: pertaining to a month, or to each month.
derive: to receive or obtain from a source or origin (usually followed by from).
nazareth: a town in N Israel: the childhood home of Jesus.
religion: a set of beliefs concerning the cause, nature, and purpose of the universe, especially when considered as the creation of a superhuman agency or agencies, usually involving devotional and ritual observances, and often containing a moral code governing the conduct of human affairs.
fulfillment: the act or state of fulfilling: to witness the fulfillment of a dream; to achieve fulfillment of one's hopes.
testament: His staying power is a testament to the poptimist adage that if someone likes something, it must have some merit.
eventual: happening at some indefinite future time or after a series of occurrences; ultimate: His mistakes led to his eventual dismissal.
messiah: the promised and expected deliverer of the Jewish people.
deeply: at or to a considerable extent downward; well within or beneath a surface.
pay: to settle (a debt, obligation, etc.), as by transferring money or goods, or by doing something: Please pay your bill.
supreme: highest in rank or authority; paramount; sovereign; chief.
creator: a person or thing that creates.
universe: the totality of known or supposed objects and phenomena throughout space; the cosmos; macrocosm.
dedicated: wholly committed to something, as to an ideal, political cause, or personal goal: a dedicated artist.
consideration: the act of considering; careful thought; meditation; deliberation: I will give your project full consideration.
requisite: required or necessary for a particular purpose, position, etc.; indispensable: the requisite skills of an engineer.
rotate: to cause to turn around an axis or center point; revolve.
magnetize: to make a magnet of or impart the properties of a magnet to.
thread: a fine cord of flax, cotton, or other fibrous material spun out to considerable length, especially when composed of two or more filaments twisted together.
sewing: the act or work of one who sews.
magnet: a body, as a piece of iron or steel, that possesses the property of attracting certain substances, as iron.
magnetism: the properties of attraction possessed by magnets; the molecular properties common to magnets.
effective: adequate to accomplish a purpose; producing the intended or expected result: effective teaching methods; effective steps toward peace.
striking: attractive; impressive: a scene of striking beauty.
blow: a sudden, hard stroke with a hand, fist, or weapon: a blow to the head.
lie: a false statement made with deliberate intent to deceive; an intentional untruth; a falsehood. Synonyms: prevarication, falsification.
erroneous: containing error; mistaken; incorrect; wrong: an erroneous answer.
untruthful: not truthful; wanting in veracity; diverging from or contrary to the truth; not corresponding with fact or reality.
happy: delighted, pleased, or glad, as over a particular thing: to be happy to see a person.
ever: at all times; always: an ever-present danger; He is ever ready to find fault.
bend: to force (an object, especially a long or thin one) from a straight form into a curved or angular one, or from a curved or angular form into some different form: to bend an iron rod into a hoop.
angle: If Obama had once looked like the hesitator-in-chief, next to Brewer and angle he looked like César Chávez.
beaten: formed or shaped by blows; hammered: a dish of beaten brass.
lead: to go before or with to show the way; conduct or escort: to lead a group on a cross-country hike.
forehead: the part of the face above the eyebrows; brow.
chin: the lower extremity of the face, below the mouth.
could: a simple past tense of can1 .
intervene: to come between disputing people, groups, etc.; intercede; mediate.
mounting: the act of a person or thing that mounts.
estate: a piece of landed property, especially one of large extent with an elaborate house on it: to have an estate in the country.
physician: a person who is legally qualified to practice medicine; doctor of medicine.
surgeon: a physician who specializes in surgery.
dentist: a person whose profession is dentistry.
veterinarian: a person who practices veterinary medicine or surgery.
entity: something that has a real existence; thing: corporeal entities.
strike: to deal a blow or stroke to (a person or thing), as with the fist, a weapon, or a hammer; hit.
fist: the hand closed tightly, with the fingers doubled into the palm.
heavy: of great weight; hard to lift or carry: a heavy load.
abbey: a monastery under the supervision of an abbot or a convent under the supervision of an abbess.
anna: a former cupronickel coin of Pakistan, the 16th part of a rupee: last issued in 1960.
marie: (Marie Alexandra Victoria of Saxe-Coburg) 1875–1938, queen of Romania 1914–27.
jazz: music originating in New Orleans around the beginning of the 20th century and subsequently developing through various increasingly complex styles, generally marked by intricate, propulsive rhythms, polyphonic ensemble playing, improvisatory, virtuosic solos, melodic freedom, and a harmonic idiom ranging from simple diatonicism through chromaticism to atonality.
singer: a person who sings, especially a trained or professional vocalist.
activist: an especially active, vigorous advocate of a cause, especially a political cause.
actress: a woman who acts in stage plays, motion pictures, television broadcasts, etc., especially professionally.
joseph: Jacob's eleventh son, the first of Jacob and his second wife, Rachel: sold into slavery by his brothers. Gen. 30:22–24; 37.
actor: a person who acts in stage plays, motion pictures, television broadcasts, etc.
watercourse: a stream of water, as a river or brook.
brook: a small, natural stream of fresh water.
justly: in a just manner; honestly; fairly: Deal justly with the prisoners.
waterway: a river, canal, or other body of water serving as a route or way of travel or transport.
diverge: to move, lie, or extend in different directions from a common point; branch off.
converge: to tend to meet in a point or line; incline toward each other, as lines that are not parallel.
heroism: the qualities or attributes of a hero or heroine: He showed great heroism in battle.
globe: the planet Earth (usually preceded by the).
interdependent: mutually dependent; depending on each other.
epic: noting or pertaining to a long poetic composition, usually centered upon a hero, in which a series of great achievements or events is narrated in elevated style: Homer's Iliad is an epic poem.
while: a period or interval of time: to wait a long while; He arrived a short while ago.
harp: a musical instrument consisting of a triangular frame formed by a soundbox, a pillar, and a curved neck, and having strings stretched between the soundbox and the neck that are plucked with the fingers.
lyre: a musical instrument of ancient Greece consisting of a soundbox made typically from a turtle shell, with two curved arms connected by a yoke from which strings are stretched to the body, used especially to accompany singing and recitation.
stratford: a town in SW Connecticut, near Bridgeport: Shakespeare theater.
severn: a river in Great Britain, flowing from central Wales through W England into the Bristol Channel. 210 miles (338 km) long.
christmas: the annual festival of the Christian church commemorating the birth of Jesus: celebrated on December 25 and now generally observed as a legal holiday and an occasion for exchanging gifts.
season: one of the four periods of the year (spring, summer, autumn, and winter), beginning astronomically at an equinox or solstice, but geographically at different dates in different climates.
desert: a region so arid because of little rainfall that it supports only sparse and widely spaced vegetation or no vegetation at all: The Sahara is a vast sandy desert.
baroque: (often initial capital letter) of or relating to a style of architecture and art originating in Italy in the early 17th century and variously prevalent in Europe and the New World for a century and a half, characterized by free and sculptural use of the classical orders and ornament, by forms in elevation and plan suggesting movement, and by dramatic effect in which architecture, painting, sculpture, and the decorative arts often worked to combined effect.
austere: severe in manner or appearance; uncompromising; strict; forbidding: an austere teacher.
liking: preference, inclination, or favor: to show a liking for privacy.
hat: a shaped covering for the head, usually with a crown and brim, especially for wear outdoors.
exclamation: the act of exclaiming; outcry; loud complaint or protest: The speech was continually interrupted by rude exclamations.
punctuation: the practice or system of using certain conventional marks or characters in writing or printing in order to separate elements and make the meaning clear, as in ending a sentence or separating clauses.
communicative: inclined to communicate or impart; talkative: He isn't feeling very communicative today.
intonation: the pattern or melody of pitch changes in connected speech, especially the pitch pattern of a sentence, which distinguishes kinds of sentences or speakers of different language cultures.
received: generally or traditionally accepted; conventional; standard: a received moral idea.
lawful: allowed or permitted by law; not contrary to law: a lawful enterprise.
declaration: the act of declaring; announcement: a declaration of a dividend.
determination: the act of coming to a decision or of fixing or settling a purpose.
inflict: to impose as something that must be borne or suffered: to inflict punishment.
retaliation: the act of retaliating; return of like for like; reprisal.
menace: something that threatens to cause evil, harm, injury, etc.; a threat: Air pollution is a menace to health.
swift: moving or capable of moving with great speed or velocity; fleet; rapid: a swift ship.
pickpocket: a person who steals money, wallets, etc., from the pockets of people, as in crowded public places.
watch: to be alertly on the lookout, look attentively, or observe, as to see what comes, is done, or happens: to watch while an experiment is performed.
trio: a musical composition for three voices or instruments.
silence: absence of any sound or noise; stillness.
guilt: the fact or state of having committed an offense, crime, violation, or wrong, especially against moral or penal law; culpability: He admitted his guilt.
program: a plan of action to accomplish a specified end: a school lunch program.
manual: done, operated, worked, etc., by the hand or hands rather than by an electrical or electronic device: a manual gearshift.
stem: the ascending axis of a plant, whether above or below ground, which ordinarily grows in an opposite direction to the root or descending axis.
shrub: a woody plant smaller than a tree, usually having multiple permanent stems branching from or near the ground.
bark: the abrupt, harsh, explosive cry of a dog.
xylem: a compound tissue in vascular plants that helps provide support and that conducts water and nutrients upward from the roots, consisting of tracheids, vessels, parenchyma cells, and woody fibers.
juicy: full of juice; succulent: a juicy pear.
rag: a worthless piece of cloth, especially one that is torn or worn.
stalk: the stem or main axis of a plant.
species: a class of individuals having some common characteristics or qualities; distinct sort or kind.
wheat: the grain of any cereal grass of the genus Triticum, especially T. aestivum, used in the form of flour for making bread, cakes, etc., and for other culinary and nutritional purposes.
rye: a widely cultivated cereal grass, Secale cereale, having one-nerved glumes and two- or three-flowered spikelets.
barley: a widely distributed cereal plant belonging to the genus Hordeum, of the grass family, having awned flowers that grow in tightly bunched spikes, with three small additional spikes at each node.
inquire: to seek information by questioning; ask: to inquire about a person.
inheritance: something that is or may be inherited; property passing at the owner's death to the heir or those entitled to succeed; legacy.
recompense: to repay; remunerate; reward, as for service, aid, etc.
safekeeping: the act of keeping safe or the state of being kept safe; protection; care; custody.
bank: a long pile or heap; mass: a bank of earth; a bank of clouds.
paycheck: a bank check given as salary or wages.
friday: the sixth day of the week, following Thursday.
belong: to be in the relation of a member, adherent, inhabitant, etc. (usually followed by to): He belongs to the Knights of Columbus.
customer: a person who purchases goods or services from another; buyer; patron.
proprietor: the owner of a business establishment, a hotel, etc.
develop: to bring out the capabilities or possibilities of; bring to a more advanced or effective state: to develop natural resources; to develop one's musical talent.
nice: pleasing; agreeable; delightful: a nice visit.
weekday: any day of the week except Sunday or, often, Saturday and Sunday.
soviet: The latest slip: appearing on a radio show, she said that Americans are worried about “the rise of the soviet Union.”
socialist: an advocate or supporter of socialism.
nonmetallic: of or relating to a nonmetal.
amorphous: lacking definite form; having no specific shape; formless: the amorphous clouds.
fourth: next after the third; being the ordinal number for four.
crust: the brown, hard outer portion or surface of a loaf or slice of bread (distinguished from crumb).
si: the syllable used for the seventh tone of a scale and sometimes for the tone B.
manganese: a hard, brittle, grayish-white, metallic element, an oxide of which, MnO 2 (manganese dioxide) is a valuable oxidizing agent: used chiefly as an alloying agent in steel to give it toughness. Symbol:  Mn; atomic weight:  54.938; atomic number:  25; specific gravity:  7.2 at 20°C.
glitter: to reflect light with a brilliant, sparkling luster; sparkle with reflected light.
sparkle: to issue in or as if in little sparks, as fire or light: The candlelight sparkled in the crystal.
gloss: a superficial luster or shine; glaze: the gloss of satin.
satin: a fabric in a warp-effect or filling-effect satin weave, as acetate, rayon, nylon, or silk, often having a glossy face and a soft, slippery texture.
variegated: varied in appearance or color; marked with patches or spots of different colors.
greenish: somewhat green; having a tinge of green.
microcrystalline: minutely crystalline; composed of microscopic crystals.
milky: of or like milk, especially in appearance or consistency.
grayish: having a tinge of gray; slightly gray: The sky was full of dark, grayish clouds.
purple: any color having components of both red and blue, such as lavender, especially one deep in tone.
lemon: the yellowish, acid fruit of a subtropical citrus tree, Citrus limon.
debris: the remains of anything broken down or destroyed; ruins; rubble: the debris of buildings after an air raid.
sedimentary: of, relating to, or of the nature of sediment.
silica: the dioxide form of silicon, SiO 2 , occurring especially as quartz sand, flint, and agate: used usually in the form of its prepared white powder chiefly in the manufacture of glass, water glass, ceramics, and abrasives.
carbonate: a salt or ester of carbonic acid.
iron: Compare cast iron, pig iron, steel, wrought iron.
piezoelectricity: electricity, or electric polarity, produced by the piezoelectric effect.
zone: any continuous tract or area that differs in some respect, or is distinguished for some purpose, from adjoining tracts or areas, or within which certain distinctive circumstances exist or are established.
frequency: Also, frequence. the state or fact of being frequent; frequent occurrence: We are alarmed by the frequency of fires in the neighborhood.
telegraphy: the art or practice of constructing or operating telegraphs.
telephony: the construction or operation of telephones or telephonic systems.
broadcast: to transmit (programs) from a radio or television station.
transmitter: a person or thing that transmits.
aluminosilicate: any naturally occurring or synthetically produced aluminum silicate containing alkali-metal or alkaline-earth-metal ions, as a feldspar, zeolite, or beryl.
silvery: resembling silver; of a lustrous grayish-white color: the silvery moon.
fertilizer: any substance used to fertilize the soil, especially a commercial or chemical manure.
peroxide: Covering her peroxide blond bob was a knit cap that sprouted an enormous feather and lace from its frontal lobe.
cyanide: Two years later, at the age of 41, the war hero ended his own life with cyanide.
tetraethyllead: a colorless, oily, water-insoluble, poisonous liquid, (C 2 H 5) 4 Pb, used as an antiknock agent in gasoline.
maintenance: the act of maintaining: the maintenance of proper oral hygiene.
balance: a state of equilibrium or equipoise; equal distribution of weight, amount, etc.
divalent: having a valence of two, as the ferrous ion, Fe ++ .
limestone: a sedimentary rock consisting predominantly of calcium carbonate, varieties of which are formed from the skeletons of marine microorganisms and coral: used as a building stone and in the manufacture of lime.
chalk: a soft, white, powdery limestone consisting chiefly of fossil shells of foraminifers.
gypsum: a very common mineral, hydrated calcium sulfate, CaSO 4 ⋅2H 2 O, occurring in crystals and in masses, soft enough to be scratched by the fingernail: used to make plaster of Paris, as an ornamental material, as a fertilizer, etc.
bone: Hunter S. Thompson had this ability; his words cut the most powerful men in America to the bone.
skeletal: of, relating to, or like a skeleton.
conduction: the act of conducting, as of water through a pipe.
heartbeat: a pulsation of the heart, including one complete systole and diastole.
muscle: a tissue composed of cells or fibers, the contraction of which produces movement in the body.
contraction: an act or instance of contracting.
cleavage: the act of cleaving or splitting.
stated: fixed or settled: a stated price.
strictly: in a strict manner; rigorously; stringently: strictly enforced.
description: a statement, picture in words, or account that describes; descriptive representation.
brittle: having hardness and rigidity but little tensile strength; breaking readily with a comparatively smooth fracture, as glass.
fusion: the act or process of fusing; the state of being fused.
lime: Also called burnt lime, calcium oxide, caustic lime, calx, quicklime. a white or grayish-white, odorless, lumpy, very slightly water-soluble solid, CaO, that when combined with water forms calcium hydroxide (slaked lime) obtained from calcium carbonate, limestone, or oyster shells: used chiefly in mortars, plasters, and cements, in bleaching powder, and in the manufacture of steel, paper, glass, and various chemicals of calcium.
pyramid: At the top of the pyramid is AQIM, under which are a myriad of different groups each with their own agendas.
slavery: the condition of a slave; bondage.
assurance: a positive declaration intended to give confidence: He received assurances of support for the project.
custom: a habitual practice; the usual way of acting in given circumstances.
distributed: (in distinctive feature analysis) characterized by relatively extensive contact or constriction between the articulating organs, as the (sh) in show in contrast to the (s) in so.
diamond: a pure or nearly pure, extremely hard form of carbon, naturally crystallized in the isometric system.
charcoal: the carbonaceous material obtained by heating wood or other organic substances in the absence of air.
fountain: a spring or source of water; the source or head of a stream.
bitumen: any of various natural substances, as asphalt, maltha, or gilsonite, consisting mainly of hydrocarbons.
alkane: any member of the alkane series.
methane: a colorless, odorless, flammable gas, CH 4 , the main constituent of marsh gas and the firedamp of coal mines, obtained commercially from natural gas: the first member of the methane, or alkane, series of hydrocarbons.
alkene: any member of the alkene series.
alkyne: any member of the alkyne series.
acetylene: a colorless gas, C 2 H 2 , having an etherlike odor, produced usually by the action of water on calcium carbide or by pyrolysis of natural gas: used especially in metal cutting and welding, as an illuminant, and in organic synthesis.
aromatic: having an aroma; fragrant or sweet-scented; odoriferous.
benzene: a colorless, volatile, flammable, toxic, slightly water-soluble, liquid, aromatic compound, C 6 H 6 , obtained chiefly from coal tar: used in the manufacture of commercial and medicinal chemicals, dyes, and as a solvent for resins, fats, or the like.
volatile: evaporating rapidly; passing off readily in the form of vapor: Acetone is a volatile solvent.
texture: the visual and especially tactile quality of a surface: rough texture.
intermediate: being, situated, or acting between two points, stages, things, persons, etc.: the intermediate steps in a procedure.
peat: a highly organic material found in marshy or damp regions, composed of partially decayed vegetable matter: it is cut and dried for use as fuel.
conductor: a person who conducts; a leader, guide, director, or manager.
agriculture: the science, art, or occupation concerned with cultivating land, raising crops, and feeding, breeding, and raising livestock; farming.
copper: a malleable, ductile, metallic element having a characteristic reddish-brown color: used in large quantities as an electrical conductor and in the manufacture of alloys, as brass and bronze. Symbol:  Cu; atomic weight:  63.54; atomic number:  29; specific gravity:  8.92 at 20°C.
opacity: the state or quality of being opaque.
conductivity: Physics. the property or power of conducting heat, electricity, or sound.
ingredient: something that enters as an element into a mixture: Flour, eggs, and sugar are the main ingredients in the cake.
intent: something that is intended; purpose; design; intention: The original intent of the committee was to raise funds.
abstract: thought of apart from concrete realities, specific objects, or actual instances: an abstract idea.
receptacle: a container, device, etc., that receives or holds something: a receptacle for trash.
bowl: a rather deep, round dish or basin, used chiefly for holding liquids, food, etc.
pestle: a tool for pounding or grinding substances in a mortar.
craft: an art, trade, or occupation requiring special skill, especially manual skill: the craft of a mason.
mason: a person whose trade is building with units of various natural or artificial mineral products, as stones, bricks, cinder blocks, or tiles, usually with the use of mortar or cement as a bonding agent.
pierced: punctured or perforated, as to form a decorative design: a pendant in pierced copper.
privacy: the state of being apart from other people or concealed from their view; solitude; seclusion: Please leave the room and give me some privacy.
subdivide: to divide (that which has already been divided) into smaller parts; divide again after a first division.
weigh: to determine or ascertain the force that gravitation exerts upon (a person or thing) by use of a balance, scale, or other mechanical device: to weigh oneself; to weigh potatoes; to weigh gases.
ornamented: (of a character) highly embellished or ornate; altered by embellishment.
hammer: a tool consisting of a solid head, usually of metal, set crosswise on a handle, used for beating metals, driving nails, etc.
brass: any of various metal alloys consisting mainly of copper and zinc.
driveway: a road, especially a private one, leading from a street or other thoroughfare to a building, house, garage, etc.
roller: a person or thing that rolls.
gnawing: the act of a person or thing that gnaws.
dull: not sharp; blunt: a dull knife.
discolor: to change or spoil the color of; fade or stain.
dynamics: (used with a singular verb) Physics. the branch of mechanics that deals with the motion and equilibrium of systems under the action of forces, usually from outside the system.
volcano: a vent in the earth's crust through which lava, steam, ashes, etc., are expelled, either continuously or at irregular intervals.
eruption: an issuing forth suddenly and violently; outburst; outbreak.
crystallize: to form into crystals; cause to assume crystalline form.
melt: to become liquefied by warmth or heat, as ice, snow, butter, or metal.
steep: having an almost vertical slope or pitch, or a relatively high gradient, as a hill, an ascent, stairs, etc.
coast: the land next to the sea; seashore: the rocky coast of Maine.
headland: a promontory extending into a large body of water.
split: to divide or separate from end to end or into layers: to split a log in two.
cleavable: capable of being cleft or split.
consolidated: brought together into a single whole.
unification: the process of unifying or uniting; union: the unification of the 13 original colonies.
petrology: the scientific study of rocks, including petrography and petrogenesis.
plastics: of or relating to a plastic or plastics: a plastics firm; plastics research.
hardened: made or become hard or harder.
cellulose: an inert carbohydrate, (C 6 H 10 O 5) n, the chief constituent of the cell walls of plants and of wood, cotton, hemp, paper, etc.
casein: Biochemistry. a protein precipitated from milk, as by rennet, and forming the basis of cheese and certain plastics.
decoration: something used for decorating; adornment; embellishment: The gymnasium was adorned with posters and crepe-paper decorations for the dance.
trademark: any name, symbol, figure, letter, word, or mark adopted and used by a manufacturer or merchant in order to designate his or her goods and to distinguish them from those manufactured or sold by others. A trademark is a proprietary term that is usually registered with the Patent and Trademark Office to assure its exclusive use by its owner.
bakelite: a brand name for any of a series of thermosetting plastics prepared by heating phenol or cresol with formaldehyde and ammonia under pressure: used for radio cabinets, telephone receivers, electric insulators, and molded plastic ware.
vinylite: a brand name for a series of thermoplastic, nontoxic, acid-resistant, vinyl resins or plastics: used in coatings, adhesives, film, molded ware, and phonograph records.
lucite: a transparent or translucent plastic, any of a class of methyl methacrylate ester polymers.
silicate: Mineralogy. any of the largest group of mineral compounds, as quartz, beryl, garnet, feldspar, mica, and various kinds of clay, consisting of SiO 2 or SiO 4 groupings and one or more metallic ions, with some forms containing hydrogen. Silicates constitute well over 90 percent of the rock-forming minerals of the earth's crust.
ceramic: of or relating to products made from clay and similar materials, as pottery and brick, or to their manufacture: ceramic art.
ware: articles of merchandise or manufacture; goods: a peddler selling his wares.
earthenware: pottery of baked or hardened clay, especially any of the coarse, opaque varieties.
stoneware: a hard, opaque, vitrified ceramic ware.
finish: to bring (something) to an end or to completion; complete: to finish a novel; to finish breakfast.
disintegrate: to separate into parts or lose intactness or solidness; break up; deteriorate: The old book is gradually disintegrating with age.
decomposition: the act or process of decomposing.
fertility: the state or quality of being fertile.
nonmetal: an element not having the character of a metal, as carbon or nitrogen.
mixed: put together or formed by mixing.
dairy: an establishment, as a room, building, or buildings, where milk and cream are kept and butter and cheese are made.
buoyancy: the power to float or rise in a fluid; relative lightness.
dynamic: pertaining to or characterized by energy or effective action; vigorously active or forceful; energetic: the dynamic president of the firm.
powered: (of a machine, vehicle, etc.) having a specified fuel or prime mover: a gasoline-powered engine; an engine-powered pump.
flew: a simple past tense of fly1 .
push: to press upon or against (a thing) with force in order to move it away.
shove: to move along by force from behind; push.
better: of superior quality or excellence: a better coat; a better speech.
aviation: the design, development, production, operation, and use of aircraft, especially heavier-than-air aircraft.
badge: a special or distinctive mark, token, or device worn as a sign of allegiance, membership, authority, achievement, etc.: a police badge; a merit badge.
informal: without formality or ceremony; casual: an informal visit.
spread: to draw, stretch, or open out, especially over a flat surface, as something rolled or folded (often followed by out).
propeller: a device having a revolving hub with radiating blades, for propelling an airplane, ship, etc.
nozzle: a projecting spout, terminal discharging pipe, or the like, as of a hose or bellows.
orifice: an opening or aperture, as of a tube or pipe; a mouthlike opening or hole; mouth; vent.
bomb: Military. a projectile, formerly usually spherical, filled with a bursting charge and exploded by means of a fuze, by impact, or otherwise, now generally designed to be dropped from an aircraft.
violent: acting with or characterized by uncontrolled, strong, rough force: a violent earthquake.
gunpowder: an explosive mixture, as of potassium nitrate, sulfur, and charcoal, used in shells and cartridges, in fireworks, for blasting, etc.
implosion: the act of imploding; a bursting inward (opposed to explosion).
dignified: characterized or marked by dignity of aspect or manner; stately; decorous: dignified conduct.
merely: only as specified and nothing more; simply: merely a matter of form.
unequivocal: not equivocal; unambiguous; clear; having only one possible meaning or interpretation: an unequivocal indication of assent; unequivocal proof.
disposed: having a certain inclination or disposition; inclined (usually followed by to or an infinitive): a man disposed to like others.
inclined: deviating in direction from the horizontal or vertical; sloping.
drop: a small quantity of liquid that falls or is produced in a more or less spherical mass; a liquid globule.
descend: to go or pass from a higher to a lower place; move or come down: to descend from the mountaintop.
lack: deficiency or absence of something needed, desirable, or customary: lack of money; lack of skill.
crude: in a raw or unprepared state; unrefined or natural: crude sugar.
ester: a compound produced by the reaction between an acid and an alcohol with the elimination of a molecule of water, as ethyl acetate, C 4 H 8 O 2 , or dimethyl sulfate, C 2 H 6 SO 4 .
sulfuric: of, relating to, or containing sulfur, especially in the hexavalent state.
acid: Chemistry. a compound usually having a sour taste and capable of neutralizing alkalis and reddening blue litmus paper, containing hydrogen that can be replaced by a metal or an electropositive group to form a salt, or containing an atom that can accept a pair of electrons from a base. Acids are proton donors that yield hydronium ions in water solution, or electron-pair acceptors that combine with electron-pair donors or bases.
disease: a disordered or incorrectly functioning organ, part, structure, or system of the body resulting from the effect of genetic or developmental errors, infection, poisons, nutritional deficiency or imbalance, toxicity, or unfavorable environmental factors; illness; sickness; ailment.
remedy: something that cures or relieves a disease or bodily disorder; a healing medicine, application, or treatment.
contract: an agreement between two or more parties for the doing or not doing of something specified.
binding: the act of fastening, securing, uniting, or the like.
washing: the act of a person or thing that washes; ablution.
alkali: A man would die of alkali in this place before he's waited on.
odor: the property of a substance that activates the sense of smell: to have an unpleasant odor.
consent: to permit, approve, or agree; comply or yield (often followed by to or an infinitive): He consented to the proposal. We asked her permission, and she consented.
model: a standard or example for imitation or comparison.
till: up to the time of; until: to fight till death.
millimole: one thousandth of a mole. Abbreviation:  mM.
acceptance: the act of taking or receiving something offered.
agreement: the act of agreeing or of coming to a mutual arrangement.
resettle: to settle or cause to settle in a new or different place
relocate: to move (a building, company, etc.) to a different location: plans to relocate the firm to Houston.
electrolyte: Just before charging the battery, again fill with 1.275 electrolyte to 3/8 inch over the top of the separators.
subsequent: occurring or coming later or after (often followed by to): subsequent events; Subsequent to their arrival in Chicago, they bought a new car.
migration: the process or act of migrating.
positively: with certainty; absolutely: The statement is positively true.
charged: intense; impassioned: an emotionally charged speech.
particle: a minute portion, piece, fragment, or amount; a tiny or very small bit: a particle of dust; not a particle of supporting evidence.
citizen: a native or naturalized member of a state or nation who owes allegiance to its government and is entitled to its protection (distinguished from alien).
exclude: to shut or keep out; prevent the entrance of.
eskimo: a member of an indigenous people of Greenland, northern Canada, Alaska, and northeastern Siberia, characterized by short, stocky build and light-brown complexion.
esculent: suitable for use as food; edible.
useful: being of use or service; serving some purpose; advantageous, helpful, or of good effect: a useful member of society.
subdivision: the act or fact of subdividing.
subfamily: Biology. a category of related genera within a family.
latin: an Italic language spoken in ancient Rome, fixed in the 2nd or 1st century b.c., and established as the official language of the Roman Empire. Abbreviation:  L.
praise: the act of expressing approval or admiration; commendation; laudation.
please: (used as a polite addition to requests, commands, etc.) if you would be so obliging; kindly: Please come here. Will you please turn the radio off?
hereafter: after this in time or order; at some future time; farther along.
imminent: likely to occur at any moment; impending: Her death is imminent.
attending: having primary responsibility for a patient.
uncommon: not common; unusual; rare: an uncommon word.
financial: pertaining to monetary receipts and expenditures; pertaining or relating to money matters; pecuniary: financial operations.
flourishing: growing vigorously; thriving; prosperous: a flourishing little business.
attempt: to make an effort at; try; undertake; seek: to attempt an impossible task; to attempt to walk six miles.
endeavor: to exert oneself to do or effect something; make an effort; strive: We must constantly endeavor if we are to succeed.
rapid: occurring within a short time; happening speedily: rapid growth.
infinitesimal: indefinitely or exceedingly small; minute: infinitesimal vessels in the circulatory system.
suffering: the state of a person or thing that suffers.
jealous: feeling resentment against someone because of that person's rivalry, success, or advantages (often followed by of): He was jealous of his rich brother.
compelling: tending to compel, as to force or push toward a course of action; overpowering: There were compelling reasons for their divorce.
married: united in wedlock; wedded: married couples.
husband: a married man, especially when considered in relation to his partner in marriage.
morphology: the branch of biology dealing with the form and structure of organisms.
syntax: the rules or patterns so studied: English syntax.
alter: to make different in some particular, as size, style, course, or the like; modify: to alter a coat; to alter a will; to alter course.
amend: to alter, modify, rephrase, or add to or subtract from (a motion, bill, constitution, etc.) by formal procedure: Congress may amend the proposed tax bill.
mostly: for the most part; in the main: The work is mostly done.
describe: to tell or depict in written or spoken words; give an account of: He described the accident very carefully.
discerning: showing good or outstanding judgment and understanding: a discerning critic of French poetry.
discernment: the faculty of discerning; discrimination; acuteness of judgment and understanding.
discretion: the power or right to decide or act according to one's own judgment; freedom of judgment or choice: It is entirely within my discretion whether I will go or stay.
definition: the act of defining, or of making something definite, distinct, or clear: We need a better definition of her responsibilities.
ideal: a conception of something in its perfection.
gentleman: a man of good family, breeding, or social position.
match: a slender piece of wood, cardboard, or other flammable material tipped with a chemical substance that produces fire when rubbed on a rough or chemically prepared surface.
attractive: providing pleasure or delight, especially in appearance or manner; pleasing; charming; alluring: an attractive personality.
imposing: very impressive because of great size, stately appearance, dignity, elegance, etc.: Notre Dame, Rheims, and other imposing cathedrals of France.
census: an official enumeration of the population, with details as to age, sex, occupation, etc.
exodus: a going out; a departure or emigration, usually of a large number of people: the summer exodus to the country and shore.
egypt: Arab Republic of. a republic in NE Africa. 386,198 sq. mi. (1,000,252 sq. km). Capital:  Cairo.
china: a translucent ceramic material, biscuit-fired at a high temperature, its glaze fired at a low temperature.
exhibition: an exhibiting, showing, or presenting to view.
compassionate: having or showing compassion: a compassionate person; a compassionate letter.
forbearance: the act of forbearing; a refraining from something.
compassion: a feeling of deep sympathy and sorrow for another who is stricken by misfortune, accompanied by a strong desire to alleviate the suffering.
benevolence: desire to do good to others; goodwill; charitableness: to be filled with benevolence toward one's fellow creatures.
designed: made or done intentionally; intended; planned.
adjectival: of, relating to, or used as an adjective.
us: the objective case of we, used as a direct or indirect object: They took us to the circus. She asked us the way.
lapse: an accidental or temporary decline or deviation from an expected or accepted condition or state; a temporary falling or slipping from a previous standard: a lapse of justice.
once: at one time in the past; formerly: I was a farmer once; a once powerful nation.
portable: capable of being transported or conveyed: a portable stage.
supple: bending readily without breaking or becoming deformed; pliant; flexible: a supple bough.
visor: In lieu of that, Alexa points to a pin on her visor that bears the Raiders logo.
brim: the upper edge of anything hollow; rim; brink: the brim of a cup.
synonym: a word having the same or nearly the same meaning as another in the language, as happy, joyful, elated. A dictionary of synonyms and antonyms (or opposites), such as Thesaurus.com, is called a thesaurus.
sorrow: distress caused by loss, affliction, disappointment, etc.; grief, sadness, or regret.
remorse: deep and painful regret for wrongdoing; compunction.
disappointment: the act or fact of disappointing: All of his efforts only led to the disappointment of his supporters.
conscience: the inner sense of what is right or wrong in one's conduct or motives, impelling one toward right action: to follow the dictates of conscience.
sympathetic: characterized by, proceeding from, exhibiting, or feeling sympathy; sympathizing; compassionate: a sympathetic listener.
leading: chief; principal; most important; foremost: a leading toy manufacturer.
relief: alleviation, ease, or deliverance through the removal of pain, distress, oppression, etc.
disturb: to interrupt the quiet, rest, peace, or order of; unsettle.
agitate: to move or force into violent, irregular action: The hurricane winds agitated the sea.
rebuke: to express sharp, stern disapproval of; reprove; reprimand.
frost: a degree or state of coldness sufficient to cause the freezing of water.
unable: lacking the necessary power, competence, etc., to accomplish some specified act: He was unable to swim.
broke: a simple past tense of break.
symphony: Blake Gopnik explores the new show and looks at eight images that helped form a symphony of work that changed art forever.
twice: two times, as in succession: Write twice a week.
freeze: to become hardened into ice or into a solid body; change from the liquid to the solid state by loss of heat.
send: to cause, permit, or enable to go: to send a messenger; They sent their son to college.
recipient: a person or thing that receives; receiver: the recipient of a prize.
destination: the place to which a person or thing travels or is sent: Her destination was Rome.
dispatch: to send off or away with speed, as a messenger, telegram, body of troops, etc.
underground: beneath the surface of the ground: traveling underground by subway.
henry: the standard unit of inductance in the International System of Units (SI), formally defined to be the inductance of a closed circuit in which an electromotive force of one volt is produced when the electric current in the circuit varies uniformly at a rate of one ampere per second. Abbreviation:  H.
prevent: to keep from occurring; avert; hinder: He intervened to prevent bloodshed.
flow: to move along in a stream: The river flowed slowly to the sea.
chance: the absence of any cause of events that can be predicted, understood, or controlled: often personified or treated as a positive agency: Chance governs all.
meet: to come upon; come into the presence of; encounter: I would meet him on the street at unexpected moments.
nickel: Chemistry. a hard, silvery-white, ductile and malleable metallic element, allied to iron and cobalt, not readily oxidized: used chiefly in alloys, in electroplating, and as a catalyst in organic synthesis. Symbol:  Ni; atomic weight:  58.71; atomic number:  28; specific gravity:  8.9 at 20°C.
turn: to cause to move around on an axis or about a center; rotate: to turn a wheel.
western: lying toward or situated in the west: our company's western office.
horizon: the line or circle that forms the apparent boundary between earth and sky.
cloudy: full of or overcast by clouds: a cloudy sky.
foliage: the leaves of a plant, collectively; leafage.
sounding: emitting or producing a sound or sounds.
brickwork: brick construction, as contrasted with that using other materials.
shrug: to raise and contract (the shoulders), expressing indifference, disdain, etc.
former: preceding in time; prior or earlier: during a former stage in the proceedings.
approve: to speak or think favorably of; pronounce or consider agreeable or good; judge favorably: to approve the policies of the administration.
hissing: the act of emitting a hiss.
telegraph: an apparatus, system, or process for transmitting messages or signals to a distant place, especially by means of an electric device consisting essentially of a sending instrument and a distant receiving instrument connected by a conducting wire or other communications channel.
heliograph: a device for signaling by means of a movable mirror that reflects beams of light, especially sunlight, to a distance.
symbolize: to be a symbol of; stand for or represent in the manner of a symbol.
morse: an ornamented metal clasp or brooch for fastening a cope in front.
january: the first month of the year, containing 31 days. Abbreviation:  Jan.
lithe: bending readily; pliant; limber; supple; flexible: the lithe body of a ballerina.
goat: any of numerous agile, hollow-horned ruminants of the genus Capra, of the family Bovidae, closely related to the sheep, found native in rocky and mountainous regions of the Old World, and widely distributed in domesticated varieties.
africa: a continent S of Europe and between the Atlantic and Indian oceans. About 11,700,000 sq. mi. (30,303,000 sq. km).
asia: a continent bounded by Europe and the Arctic, Pacific, and Indian oceans. About 16,000,000 sq. mi. (41,440,000 sq. km).
hollow: having a space or cavity inside; not solid; empty: a hollow sphere.
landmass: a part of the continental crust above sea level having a distinct identity, as a continent or large island.
atlantic: of or relating to the Atlantic Ocean.
pacific: tending to make or preserve peace; conciliatory: pacific overtures.
ural: a river in the Russian Federation, flowing S from the S Ural Mountains to the Caspian Sea. 1575 miles (2535 km) long.
caucasus: the, Also called Caucasus Mountains. a mountain range in Caucasia, between the Black and Caspian seas, along the border between the Russian Federation, Georgia, and Azerbaijan. Highest peak, Mt. Elbrus, 18,481 feet (5633 meters).
caspian: of or relating to the Caspian Sea.
usage: a customary way of doing something; a custom or practice: the usages of the last 50 years.
northern: lying toward or situated in the north.
hemisphere: Compare Eastern Hemisphere, Western Hemisphere, Northern Hemisphere, Southern Hemisphere.
solstice: either of the two times a year when the sun is at its greatest distance from the celestial equator: about June 21, when the sun reaches its northernmost point on the celestial sphere, or about December 22, when it reaches its southernmost point. Compare summer solstice, winter solstice.
autumnal: belonging to or suggestive of autumn; produced or gathered in autumn: autumnal colors.
equinox: the time when the sun crosses the plane of the earth's equator, making night and day of approximately equal length all over the earth and occurring about March 21 (vernal equinox or spring equinox) and September 22 (autumnal equinox)
southern: lying toward, situated in, or directed toward the south.
winter: the cold season between autumn and spring in northern latitudes (in the Northern Hemisphere from the winter solstice to the vernal equinox; in the Southern Hemisphere from the summer solstice to the autumnal equinox).
vernal: of or relating to spring: vernal sunshine.
supplement: something added to complete a thing, supply a deficiency, or reinforce or extend a whole.
sleepy: ready or inclined to sleep; drowsy.
runner: a person, animal, or thing that runs, especially as a racer.
grind: to wear, smooth, or sharpen by abrasion or friction; whet: to grind a lens.
polish: to make smooth and glossy, especially by rubbing or friction: to polish a brass doorknob.
granular: of the nature of granules; grainy.
magnetite: a very common black iron oxide mineral, Fe 3 O 4 , that is strongly attracted by magnets: an important iron ore.
hematite: a very common mineral, iron oxide, Fe 2 O 3 , occurring in steel-gray to black crystals and in red earthy masses: the principal ore of iron.
spongy: of the nature of or resembling a sponge; light, porous, and elastic or readily compressible, as pith or bread.
sociability: the act or an instance of being sociable.
comprehend: to understand the nature or meaning of; grasp with the mind; perceive: He did not comprehend the significance of the ambassador's remark.
botany: the science of plants; the branch of biology that deals with plant life.
elapse: (of time) to slip or pass by: Thirty minutes elapsed before the performance began.
stretch: to draw out or extend (oneself, a body, limbs, wings, etc.) to the full length or extent (often followed by out): to stretch oneself out on the ground.
knot: an interlacing, twining, looping, etc., of a cord, rope, or the like, drawn tight into a knob or lump, for fastening, binding, or connecting two cords together or a cord to something else.

asbestos: Mineralogy. a fibrous mineral, either amphibole or chrysotile, formerly used for making incombustible or fireproof articles.
draw: to cause to move in a particular direction by or as if by a pulling force; pull; drag (often followed by along, away, in, out, or off).
slack: not tight, taut, firm, or tense; loose: a slack rope.
pliant: bending readily; flexible; supple; adaptable: She manipulated the pliant clay.
auxiliary: additional; supplementary; reserve: an auxiliary police force.
doe: the female of the deer, antelope, goat, rabbit, and certain other animals.
basic: of, relating to, or forming a base; fundamental: a basic principle; the basic ingredient.
aflame: on fire; ablaze: The house was all aflame.
tallow: the fatty tissue or suet of animals.
wax: Also called beeswax. a solid, yellowish, nonglycerine substance allied to fats and oils, secreted by bees, plastic when warm and melting at about 145°F, variously employed in making candles, models, casts, ointments, etc., and used by bees in constructing their honeycomb.
wick: a bundle or loose twist or braid of soft threads, or a woven strip or tube, as of cotton or asbestos, which in a candle, lamp, oil stove, cigarette lighter, or the like, serves to draw up the melted tallow or wax or the oil or other flammable liquid to be burned.
zealous: full of, characterized by, or due to zeal; ardently active, devoted, or diligent. Synonyms: enthusiastic, eager, fervid, fervent, intense, passionate, warm.
ardent: having, expressive of, or characterized by intense feeling; passionate; fervent: an ardent vow; ardent love.
loyalty: the state or quality of being loyal; faithfulness to commitments or obligations.

skirt: the part of a gown, dress, slip, or coat that extends downward from the waist.
accepting: amenable; open: She was always more accepting of coaching suggestions than her teammates.
mascara: a substance used as a cosmetic to color the eyelashes and eyebrows.
apprehend: to take into custody; arrest by legal warrant or authority: The police apprehended the burglars.

tillage: the operation, practice, or art of tilling land.
personally: through direct contact; in person; directly: I will thank him personally.
encounter: to come upon or meet with, especially unexpectedly: to encounter a new situation.
woods: Eldrick  [el-drik]  /ˈɛl drɪk/  (Show IPA), ("Tiger") born 1975, U.S. professional golfer.
procure: to obtain or get by care, effort, or the use of special means: to procure evidence.
income: the monetary payment received for goods or services, or from other sources, as rents or investments.
football: Compare conversion (def 13), field goal (def 1), safety (def 6), touchdown.
acquisition: the act of acquiring or gaining possession: the acquisition of real estate.
reflection: the act of reflecting, as in casting back a light or heat, mirroring, or giving back or showing an image; the state of being reflected in this way.
scholarship: learning; knowledge acquired by study; the academic attainments of a scholar.
genetic: Biology. pertaining or according to genetics.
exclusion: an act or instance of excluding.
save: to rescue from danger or possible harm, injury, or loss: to save someone from drowning.
plate: a shallow, usually circular dish, often of earthenware or porcelain, from which food is eaten.
courtesy: excellence of manners or social conduct; polite behavior.
petition: a formally drawn request, often bearing the names of a number of those making the request, that is addressed to a person or group of persons in authority or power, soliciting some favor, right, mercy, or other benefit: a petition for clemency; a petition for the repeal of an unfair law.
tour: a traveling around from place to place.
righteousness: the quality or state of being righteous.
uphold: to support or defend, as against opposition or criticism: He fought the duel to uphold his family's honor.
comprehension: the act or process of comprehending.
interpretation: the act of interpreting; elucidation; explication: This writer's work demands interpretation.
agree: to have the same views, emotions, etc.; harmonize in opinion or feeling (often followed by with): I don't agree with you.
yours: (a form of the possessive case of you used as a predicate adjective): Which cup is yours? Is she a friend of yours?
contrive: to plan with ingenuity; devise; invent: The author contrived a clever plot.
elaborate: worked out with great care and nicety of detail; executed with great minuteness: elaborate preparations; elaborate care.
invent: to originate or create as a product of one's own ingenuity, experimentation, or contrivance: to invent the telegraph.
homogenize: to form by blending unlike elements; make homogeneous.
boston: a seaport in and the capital of Massachusetts, in the E part.
apparatus: a group or combination of instruments, machinery, tools, materials, etc., having a particular function or intended for a specific use: Our town has excellent fire-fighting apparatus.
interrelated: reciprocally or mutually related: an interrelated series of experiments.
disbursement: the act or an instance of disbursing.
consumption: the act of consuming, as by use, decay, or destruction.
libra: the ancient Roman pound (containing 5053 grains or 327.4 grams).
pack: a group of things wrapped or tied together for easy handling or carrying; a bundle, especially one to be carried on the back of an animal or a person: a mule pack; a hiker's pack.
indebted: committed or obligated to repay a monetary loan: He was indebted to his friend for a large sum.
tape: a long, narrow strip of linen, cotton, or the like, used for tying garments, binding seams or carpets, etc.

dust: earth or other matter in fine, dry particles.
prospect: the outlook for the future: good business prospects.
conformity: action in accord with prevailing social standards, attitudes, practices, etc.
portrait: a likeness of a person, especially of the face, as a painting, drawing, or photograph: a gallery of family portraits.
churchill: Caryl, born 1938, English playwright and feminist theorist.
execution: the act or process of executing.
complain: to express dissatisfaction, pain, uneasiness, censure, resentment, or grief; find fault: He complained constantly about the noise in the corridor.
comport: to bear or conduct (oneself); behave: He comported himself with dignity.
store: an establishment where merchandise is sold, usually on a retail basis.
abundant: present in great quantity; more than adequate; oversufficient: an abundant supply of water.
resource: a source of supply, support, or aid, especially one that can be readily drawn upon when needed.
affluent: having an abundance of wealth, property, or other material goods; prosperous; rich: an affluent person.
desk: an article of furniture having a broad, usually level, writing surface, as well as drawers or compartments for papers, writing materials, etc.
corner: the place at which two converging lines or surfaces meet.
load: anything put in or on something for conveyance or transportation; freight; cargo: The truck carried a load of watermelons.
foundation: the basis or groundwork of anything: the moral foundation of both society and religion.
appointed: by, through, or as a result of an appointment (often in contrast with elected): an appointed official.
elected: chosen by vote, as for an office (contrasted with appointed): an elected official.
bench: a long seat for several persons: a bench in the park.
pew: (in a church) one of a number of fixed, benchlike seats with backs, accessible by aisles, for the use of the congregation.

bay: a body of water forming an indentation of the shoreline, larger than a cove but smaller than a gulf.
destructive: tending to destroy; causing destruction or much damage (often followed by of or to): a very destructive windstorm.
earthquake: a series of vibrations induced in the earth's crust by the abrupt rupture and rebound of rocks in which elastic strain has been slowly accumulating.
japanese: of, relating to, or characteristic of Japan, its people, or their language.

document: a written or printed paper furnishing information or evidence, as a passport, deed, bill of sale, or bill of lading; a legal or official paper.
aboard: on board; on, in, or into a ship, train, airplane, bus, etc.: to step aboard.
september: the ninth month of the year, containing 30 days. Abbreviation:  Sept., Sep.
coating: a layer of any substance spread over a surface.
sent: simple past tense and past participle of send1 .
delivery: the carrying and turning over of letters, goods, etc., to a designated recipient or recipients.
deference: respectful submission or yielding to the judgment, opinion, will, etc., of another.
conventional: conforming or adhering to accepted standards, as of conduct or taste: conventional behavior.
economy: thrifty management; frugality in the expenditure or consumption of money, materials, etc.

madrid: a city in and the capital of Spain, in the central part.
tradition: the handing down of statements, beliefs, legends, customs, information, etc., from generation to generation, especially by word of mouth or by practice: a story that has come down to us by popular tradition.
belgium: a kingdom in W Europe, bordering the North Sea, N of France. 11,779 sq. mi. (30,508 sq. km). Capital:  Brussels.
bantu: a member of any of several peoples forming a linguistically and in some respects culturally interrelated family in central and southern Africa.
french: of, relating to, or characteristic of France, its inhabitants, or their language, culture, etc.: French cooking.

definitive: most reliable or complete, as of a text, author, criticism, study, or the like: the definitive biography of Andrew Jackson.
intricate: having many interrelated parts or facets; entangled or involved: an intricate maze.
artistic: conforming to the standards of art; satisfying aesthetic requirements: artistic productions.
rhythm: movement or procedure with uniform or patterned recurrence of a beat, accent, or the like.

wallet: a flat, folding pocketbook, especially one large enough to hold paper money, credit cards, driver's license, etc., and sometimes having a compartment for coins.
melody: musical sounds in agreeable succession or arrangement.
affix: to fasten, join, or attach (usually followed by to): to affix stamps to a letter.
un: one: young uns; He's a bad un.
unkind: lacking in kindness or mercy; severe.
repetition: the act of repeating, or doing, saying, or writing something again; repeated action, performance, production, or presentation.
reinvent: to invent again or anew, especially without knowing that the invention already exists.
pro: in favor of a proposition, opinion, etc.
compatible: capable of existing or living together in harmony: the most compatible married couple I know.
designate: to mark or point out; indicate; show; specify.
cognizant: having cognizance; aware (usually followed by of): He was cognizant of the difficulty.
helen: Also called Helen of Troy. Classical Mythology. the beautiful daughter of Zeus and Leda and wife of Menelaus whose abduction by Paris was the cause of the Trojan War.
bible: the collection of sacred writings of the Christian religion, comprising the Old and New Testaments.
israel: a republic in SW Asia, on the Mediterranean: formed as a Jewish state May 1948. 7984 sq. mi. (20,679 sq. km). Capital:  Jerusalem.
joshua: the successor of Moses as leader of the Israelites. Deut. 31:14, 23; 34:9.
accession: the act of coming into the possession of a right, title, office, etc.: accession to the throne.

saul: the first king of Israel. I Sam. 9.
horizontal: at right angles to the vertical; parallel to level ground.
player: a person or thing that plays.
arm: the upper limb of the human body, especially the part extending from the shoulder to the wrist.
shoulder: the part of each side of the body in humans, at the top of the trunk, extending from each side of the base of the neck to the region where the arm articulates with the trunk.
require: to have need of; need: He requires medical care.
pleasing: giving pleasure; agreeable; gratifying: a pleasing performance.
logical: according to or agreeing with the principles of logic: a logical inference.
chairman: the presiding officer of a meeting, committee, board, etc.
distribution: an act or instance of distributing.
progress: a movement toward a goal or to a further or higher stage: the progress of a student toward a degree.
deciding: that settles a question or dispute or leads to a final decision; determining; decisive: the deciding vote; The weather will be the deciding factor as to whether we have the picnic or not.
animated: full of life, action, or spirit; lively; vigorous: an animated debate on the death penalty.
paragraph: a distinct portion of written or printed matter dealing with a particular idea, usually beginning with an indentation on a new line.
scripture: Often, Scriptures. Also called Holy Scripture, Holy Scriptures. the sacred writings of the Old or New Testaments or both together.
import: to bring in (merchandise, commodities, workers, etc.) from a foreign country for use, sale, processing, reexport, or services.
misinterpret: to interpret, explain, or understand incorrectly.
india: Hindi Bharat. a republic in S Asia: a union comprising 25 states and 7 union territories; formerly a British colony; gained independence Aug. 15, 1947; became a republic within the Commonwealth of Nations Jan. 26, 1950. 1,246,880 sq. mi. (3,229,419 sq. km). Capital:  New Delhi.
gum: any of various viscid, amorphous exudations from plants, hardening on exposure to air and soluble in or forming a viscid mass with water.
elastic: capable of returning to its original length, shape, etc., after being stretched, deformed, compressed, or expanded: an elastic waistband; elastic fiber.
cream: the fatty part of milk, which rises to the surface when the liquid is allowed to stand unless homogenized.
amber: a pale yellow, sometimes reddish or brownish, fossil resin of vegetable origin, translucent, brittle, and capable of gaining a negative electrical charge by friction and of being an excellent insulator: used for making jewelry and other ornamental articles.
latex: a milky liquid in certain plants, as milkweeds, euphorbias, poppies, or the plants yielding India rubber, that coagulates on exposure to air.
ficus: any of numerous chiefly tropical trees, shrubs, and vines belonging to the genus Ficus, of the mulberry family, having milky sap and large, thick or stiff leaves, including the edible fig, the banyan, and many species grown as ornamentals.
reduce: to bring down to a smaller extent, size, amount, number, etc.: to reduce one's weight by 10 pounds.
exhaust: to drain of strength or energy, wear out, or fatigue greatly, as a person: I have exhausted myself working.
weary: physically or mentally exhausted by hard work, exertion, strain, etc.; fatigued; tired: weary eyes; a weary brain.
fatigue: weariness from bodily or mental exertion.
tandem: one following or behind the other: to drive horses tandem.
wheel: a circular frame or disk arranged to revolve on an axis, as on or in vehicles or machinery.
steering: the discriminatory practice by a real estate agent of maneuvering a client from a minority group away from considering a home in a white neighborhood.
umbrella: a light, small, portable, usually circular cover for protection from rain or sun, consisting of a fabric held on a collapsible frame of thin ribs radiating from the top of a carrying stick or handle.
pneumatic: of or relating to air, gases, or wind.
tread: to set down the foot or feet in walking; step; walk.
rim: the outer edge, border, margin, or brink of something, especially of a circular object.
bag: a container or receptacle of leather, plastic, cloth, paper, etc., capable of being closed at the mouth; pouch.
foam: a collection of minute bubbles formed on the surface of a liquid by agitation, fermentation, etc.: foam on a glass of beer.
kneel: to go down or rest on the knees or a knee.
amuse: to hold the attention of (someone) pleasantly; entertain or divert in an enjoyable or cheerful manner: She amused the guests with witty conversation.
instruct: to furnish with knowledge, especially by a systematic method; teach; train; educate.
imaginary: existing only in the imagination or fancy; not real; fancied: an imaginary illness; the imaginary animals in the stories of Dr. Seuss.
dog: a domesticated canid, Canis familiaris, bred in many varieties.
refreshing: having the power to restore freshness, vitality, energy, etc.: a refreshing nap.
disk: any thin, flat, circular plate or object.
knob: a projecting part, usually rounded, forming the handle of a door, drawer, or the like.
fastening: something that fastens, as a lock or clasp.
passed: having completed the act of passing.
buttonhole: the hole, slit, or loop through which a button is passed and by which it is secured.
loop: a portion of a cord, ribbon, etc., folded or doubled upon itself so as to leave an opening between the parts.
towering: very high or tall; lofty: a towering oak.
combustible: capable of catching fire and burning; inflammable; flammable: Gasoline vapor is highly combustible.
oil: any of a large class of substances typically unctuous, viscous, combustible, liquid at ordinary temperatures, and soluble in ether or alcohol but not in water: used for anointing, perfuming, lubricating, illuminating, heating, etc.
create: to cause to come into being, as something unique that would not naturally evolve or that is not made by ordinary processes.
potable: fit or suitable for drinking: potable water.
beer: an alcoholic beverage made by brewing and fermentation from cereals, usually malted barley, and flavored with hops and the like for a slightly bitter taste.
roast: to bake (meat or other food) uncovered, especially in an oven.
seed: the fertilized, matured ovule of a flowering plant, containing an embryo or rudimentary plant.
bean: the edible nutritious seed of various plants of the legume family, especially of the genus Phaseolus.
irrespective: without regard to something else, especially something specified; ignoring or discounting (usually followed by of): Irrespective of my wishes, I should go.
botanical: Also, botanic. of, pertaining to, made from, or containing plants: botanical survey; botanical drugs.
huckleberry: the dark-blue or black edible berry of any of various shrubs belonging to the genus Gaylussacia of the heath family.
strawberry: the fruit of any stemless plant belonging to the genus Fragaria, of the rose family, consisting of an enlarged fleshy receptacle bearing achenes on its exterior.
hackberry: any of several trees or shrubs belonging to the genus Celtis, of the elm family, bearing cherrylike fruit.
insipid: without distinctive, interesting, or stimulating qualities; vapid: an insipid personality.
flammable: easily set on fire; combustible; inflammable.
drizzle: to rain gently and steadily in fine drops; sprinkle: It drizzled throughout the night.
larry: a hoe with a perforated blade for mixing mortar or plaster.
per: for each; for every: Membership costs ten dollars per year. This cloth is two dollars per yard.
smog: smoke or other atmospheric pollutants combined with fog in an unhealthy or irritating mixture.
visibility: the state or fact of being visible.
lesser: smaller, as in size or importance; inferior: a lesser evil.
diffuse: to pour out and spread, as a fluid.
bog: wet, spongy ground with soil composed mainly of decayed vegetable matter.
towel: an absorbent cloth or paper for wiping and drying something wet, as one for the hands, face, or body after washing or bathing.
ammonia: a colorless, pungent, suffocating, highly water-soluble, gaseous compound, NH 3 , usually produced by the direct combination of nitrogen and hydrogen gases: used chiefly for refrigeration and in the manufacture of commercial chemicals and laboratory reagents.
nitric: containing nitrogen, usually in the pentavalent state.
agent: a person or business authorized to act on another's behalf: Our agent in Hong Kong will ship the merchandise. A best-selling author needs a good agent.
sixtieth: next after the fifty-ninth; being the ordinal number for 60.
hour: a period of time equal to one twenty-fourth of a mean solar or civil day and equivalent to 60 minutes: He slept for an hour.
sixty: a cardinal number, ten times six.
disparate: distinct in kind; essentially different; dissimilar: disparate ideas.
philosophy: the rational investigation of the truths and principles of being, knowledge, or conduct.
extensive: of great extent; wide; broad: an extensive area.
ascent: an act of ascending; upward movement; a rising movement: the ascent of a balloon.
descent: the act, process, or fact of moving from a higher to a lower position. Synonyms: falling, sinking; fall, drop.
lived: having life, a life, or lives, as specified (usually used in combination): a many-lived cat.
florida: a state in the SE United States between the Atlantic and the Gulf of Mexico. 58,560 sq. mi. (151,670 sq. km). Capital:  Tallahassee.
pattern: a decorative design, as for wallpaper, china, or textile fabrics, etc.
personality: the visible aspect of one's character as it impresses others: He has a pleasing personality.
spiritual: of, relating to, or consisting of spirit; incorporeal.
gratification: the state of being gratified; great satisfaction.
ear: the organ of hearing and equilibrium in vertebrates, in humans consisting of an external ear that gathers sound vibrations, a middle ear in which the vibrations resonate against the tympanic membrane, and a fluid-filled internal ear that maintains balance and that conducts the tympanic vibrations to the auditory nerve, which transmits them as impulses to the brain.
doorbell: a bell chime, or the like, at a door or connected with a door, rung by persons outside wanting someone inside to open the door.
delight: a high degree of pleasure or enjoyment; joy; rapture: She takes great delight in her job.
sepsis: local or generalized invasion of the body by pathogenic microorganisms or their toxins: dental sepsis; wound sepsis.
radioactive: of, pertaining to, exhibiting, or caused by radioactivity.
decay: to become decomposed; rot: vegetation that was decaying.
radon: a chemically inert, radioactive gaseous element produced by the decay of radium: emissions produced by outgassing of rock, brick, etc. are a health hazard. Symbol:  Rn; atomic number:  86; atomic weight:  222.
alpha: the first letter of the Greek alphabet (A, α).
practically: in effect; virtually: It is practically useless to protest.
fusible: capable of being fused or melted.
scientific: of or relating to science or the sciences: scientific studies.
catalyst: Chemistry. a substance that causes or accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected.
astrology: the study that assumes and attempts to interpret the influence of the heavenly bodies on human affairs.
spine: the spinal or vertebral column; backbone.
explanatory: serving to explain: an explanatory footnote.
text: the main body of matter in a manuscript, book, newspaper, etc., as distinguished from notes, appendixes, headings, illustrations, etc.
projectile: an object fired from a gun with an explosive propelling charge, such as a bullet, shell, rocket, or grenade.
cartridge: Also called cartouche. a cylindrical case of pasteboard, metal, or the like, for holding a complete charge of powder, and often also the bullet or the shot for a rifle, machine gun, or other small arm.
firing: the act of a person or thing that fires.
sheep: any of numerous ruminant mammals of the genus Ovis, of the family Bovidae, closely related to the goats, especially O. aries, bred in a number of domesticated varieties.
deckle: a board, usually of stainless steel, fitted under part of the wire in a Fourdrinier machine for supporting the pulp stack before it is sufficiently formed to support itself on the wire.
shrill: high-pitched and piercing in sound quality: a shrill cry.
machinery: an assemblage of machines or mechanical apparatuses: the machinery of a factory.
collar: the part of a shirt, coat, dress, blouse, etc., that encompasses the neckline of the garment and is sewn permanently to it, often so as to fold or roll over.
surgery: the art, practice, or work of treating diseases, injuries, or deformities by manual or operative procedures.
forefinger: the first finger next to the thumb.
projection: a projecting or protruding part. Synonyms: overhang, protrusion, jut.
uneven: not level or flat; rough; rugged: The wheels bumped and jolted over the uneven surface.
coarse: composed of relatively large parts or particles: The beach had rough, coarse sand.
carriage: a wheeled vehicle for conveying persons, as one drawn by horses and designed for comfort and elegance.
numerical: of or relating to numbers; of the nature of a number.
arabic: of, belonging to, or derived from the language or literature of the Arabs.
statue: a three-dimensional work of art, as a representational or abstract form, carved in stone or wood, molded in a plastic material, cast in bronze, or the like.
fewer: of a smaller number: fewer words and more action.
submissive: inclined or ready to submit or yield to the authority of another; unresistingly or humbly obedient: submissive servants.
compliant: complying; obeying, obliging, or yielding, especially in a submissive way: a man with a compliant nature.
timid: lacking in self-assurance, courage, or bravery; easily alarmed; timorous; shy.
sell: to transfer (goods) to or render (services) for another in exchange for money; dispose of to a purchaser for a price: He sold the car to me for $1000.
selling: of or relating to a sale or sales: the selling price of oranges.
destroy: to reduce (an object) to useless fragments, a useless form, or remains, as by rending, burning, or dissolving; injure beyond repair or renewal; demolish; ruin; annihilate.
remainder: something that remains or is left: the remainder of the day.
justify: to show (an act, claim, statement, etc.) to be just or right: The end does not always justify the means.
university: an institution of learning of the highest level, having a college of liberal arts and a program of graduate studies together with several professional schools, as of theology, law, medicine, and engineering, and authorized to confer both undergraduate and graduate degrees. Continental European universities usually have only graduate or professional schools.
monarch: a hereditary sovereign, as a king, queen, or emperor.
chessboard: the board, identical with a checkerboard, used for playing chess.
maneuver: a planned and regulated movement or evolution of troops, warships, etc.
sixteen: a cardinal number, ten plus six.
pawn: to deposit as security, as for money borrowed, especially with a pawnbroker: He raised the money by pawning his watch.
rook: a black, European crow, Corvus frugilegus, noted for its gregarious habits.
knight: a mounted soldier serving under a feudal superior in the Middle Ages.
bishop: a person who supervises a number of local churches or a diocese, being in the Greek, Roman Catholic, Anglican, and other churches a member of the highest order of the ministry.
checkmate: Once a case is made that a leak might be imminent, it is checkmate: the agent is thwarted.
folklore: the traditional beliefs, legends, customs, etc., of a people; lore of a people.
superhuman: above or beyond what is human; having a higher nature or greater powers than humans have: a superhuman being.
coinage: the act, process, or right of making coins.
currency: something that is used as a medium of exchange; money.
accounting: the theory and system of setting up, maintaining, and auditing the books of a firm; art of analyzing the financial position and operating results of a business house from a study of its sales, purchases, overhead, etc. (distinguished from bookkeeping).
expense: cost or charge: the expense of a good meal.
beryl: a mineral, beryllium aluminum silicate, Be 3 Al 2 Si 6 O 18 , usually green, but also blue, rose, white, and golden, and both opaque and transparent, the latter variety including the gems emerald and aquamarine: the principal ore of beryllium.
chromium: a lustrous, hard, brittle, metallic element used in alloy steels for hardness and corrosion resistance, as in stainless steel, and for plating other metals: chromium salts are used as pigments and mordants. Symbol:  Cr; atomic weight:  51.996; atomic number:  24; specific gravity:  7.1.
valued: highly regarded or esteemed: a valued friend.
treatment: an act or manner of treating.
fatty: consisting of, containing, or resembling fat: fatty tissue.
enlighten: to give intellectual or spiritual light to; instruct; impart knowledge to: We hope the results of our research will enlighten our colleagues.
navy: the whole body of warships and auxiliaries belonging to a country or ruler.
commission: the act of committing or entrusting a person, group, etc., with supervisory power or authority.
status: the position of an individual in relation to another or others, especially in regard to social or professional standing.
ferment: Also called organized ferment. any of a group of living organisms, as yeasts, molds, and certain bacteria, that cause fermentation.
grape: the edible, pulpy, smooth-skinned berry or fruit that grows in clusters on vines of the genus Vitis, and from which wine is made.
holiday: a day fixed by law or custom on which ordinary business is suspended in commemoration of some event or in honor of some person.
rite: a formal or ceremonial act or procedure prescribed or customary in religious or other solemn use: rites of baptism; sacrificial rites.
obligatory: required as a matter of obligation; mandatory: A reply is desirable but not obligatory.
entirely: wholly or fully; completely or unreservedly: I am not entirely satisfied with the architect's design.
suit: a set of clothing, armor, or the like, intended for wear together.
suited: appropriate: She is suited to such a job.
giraffe: a tall, long-necked, spotted ruminant, Giraffa camelopardalis, of Africa: the tallest living quadruped animal.
