cope: to struggle or deal, especially on fairly even terms or with some degree of success (usually followed by with): I will try to cope with his rudeness.
jan: a male given name, form of John.
limber: characterized by ease in bending the body; supple; lithe.
capra: Frank, 1897–1991, U.S. film director and producer, born in Italy.
mountainous: abounding in mountains: a mountainous wilderness.
ruminant: any even-toed, hoofed mammal of the suborder Ruminantia, being comprised of cloven-hoofed, cud-chewing quadrupeds, and including, besides domestic cattle, bison, buffalo, deer, antelopes, giraffes, camels, and chevrotains.
arctic: (often initial capital letter) of, relating to, or located at or near the North Pole: the arctic region.
empty: containing nothing; having none of the usual or appropriate contents: an empty bottle.
horn: one of the bony, permanent, hollow paired growths, often curved and pointed, that project from the upper part of the head of certain ungulate mammals, as cattle, sheep, goats, or antelopes.
continental: of or of the nature of a continent.
conciliatory: tending to conciliate: a conciliatory manner; conciliatory comments.
federation: the act of federating or uniting in a league.
georgia: a state in the SE United States. 58,876 sq. mi. (152,489 sq. km). Capital:  Atlanta.
azerbaijan: Also, Azerbaidzhan. Formerly Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic. a republic in Transcaucasia, N of Iran and W of the Caspian Sea. 33,430 sq. mi. (86,600 sq. km). Capital:  Baku.
elbrus: a mountain in the S Russian Federation, in the Caucasus range: the highest peak in Europe, 18,465 feet (5628 meters).
eastern: lying toward or situated in the east: the eastern half of the island.
reinforce: to strengthen with some added piece, support, or material: to reinforce a wall.
racer: a person, animal, or thing that races or takes part in a race, as a racehorse, bicycle, yacht, etc.
sharpen: to make or become sharp or sharper.
abrasion: a scraped spot or area; the result of rubbing or abrading: abrasions on his leg caused by falling on the gravel.
friction: surface resistance to relative motion, as of a body sliding or rolling.
whet: to sharpen (a knife, tool, etc.) by grinding or friction.
rubbing: an act or action of a person or thing that rubs.
doorknob: the handle or knob by which a door is opened or closed.
ore: a metal-bearing mineral or rock, or a native metal, that can be mined at a profit.
sponge: any aquatic, chiefly marine animal of the phylum Porifera, having a porous structure and usually a horny, siliceous or calcareous internal skeleton or framework, occurring in large, sessile colonies.
pith: Botany. the soft, spongy central cylinder of parenchymatous tissue in the stems of dicotyledonous plants.
multi: a pattern of several colors or hues, usually in stripes: This dress comes in pink or green multi.
sociable: inclined to associate with or be in the company of others.
client: a person or group that uses the professional advice or services of a lawyer, accountant, advertising agency, architect, etc.
ambassador: a diplomatic official of the highest rank, sent by one sovereign or state to another as its resident representative (ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary)
generality: an indefinite, unspecific, or undetailed statement: to speak in generalities about human rights.
twining: Nathan Farragut, 1897–1982, U.S. Air Force general: chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff 1957–60.
looping: the process of fitting speech to film already shot, especially by making a closed loop of the film for one scene and projecting it repeatedly until a good synchronization of film and recorded speech is achieved.
lump: a piece or mass of solid matter without regular shape or of no particular shape: a lump of coal.
cords: (used with a plural verb) clothing, especially trousers, of corded fabric; corduroys.
burlap: a plain-woven, coarse fabric of jute, hemp, or the like; gunny.
gunny: a strong, coarse material made commonly from jute, especially for bags or sacks; burlap.
cordage: fiber and wire ropes, lines, hawsers, etc., taken as a whole, especially with reference to the rigging and other equipment of a vessel.
amphibole: any of a complex group of hydrous silicate minerals, containing chiefly calcium, magnesium, sodium, iron, and aluminum, and including hornblende, tremolite, asbestos, etc., occurring as important constituents of many rocks.
chrysotile: a fibrous variety of serpentine; asbestos.
incombustible: not combustible; incapable of being burned; fireproof.
drag: to draw with force, effort, or difficulty; pull heavily or slowly along; haul; trail: They dragged the carpet out of the house.
deer: any of several ruminants of the family Cervidae, most of the males of which have solid, deciduous antlers.
rabbit: any of several soft-furred, large-eared, rodentlike burrowing mammals of the family Leporidae, allied with the hares and pikas in the order Lagomorpha, having a divided upper lip and long hind legs, usually smaller than the hares and mainly distinguished from them by bearing blind and furless young in nests rather than fully developed young in the open.
ablaze: burning; on fire: They set the logs ablaze.
suet: the hard fatty tissue about the loins and kidneys of beef, sheep, etc., used in cooking or processed to yield tallow.
honeycomb: a structure of rows of hexagonal wax cells, formed by bees in their hive for the storage of honey, pollen, and their eggs.
embed: to fix into a surrounding mass: to embed stones in cement.
stove: a portable or fixed apparatus that furnishes heat for warmth, cooking, etc., commonly using coal, oil, gas, wood, or electricity as a source of power.
burn: to undergo rapid combustion or consume fuel in such a way as to give off heat, gases, and, usually, light; be on fire: The fire burned in the grate.
zeal: fervor for a person, cause, or object; eager desire or endeavor; enthusiastic diligence; ardor.
diligent: constant in effort to accomplish something; attentive and persistent in doing anything: a diligent student.
enthusiastic: full of or characterized by enthusiasm; ardent: He seems very enthusiastic about his role in the play.
eager: keen or ardent in desire or feeling; impatiently longing: I am eager for news about them. He is eager to sing.
fervid: heated or vehement in spirit, enthusiasm, etc.: a fervid orator.
fervent: having or showing great warmth or intensity of spirit, feeling, enthusiasm, etc.; ardent: a fervent admirer; a fervent plea.
loyal: faithful to one's sovereign, government, or state: a loyal subject.
vest: a close-fitting, waist-length, sleeveless garment that buttons down the front, designed to be worn under a jacket.
girdle: a lightweight undergarment, worn especially by women, often partly or entirely of elastic or boned, for supporting and giving a slimmer appearance to the abdomen, hips, and buttocks.
blouse: a usually lightweight, loose-fitting garment for women and children, covering the body from the neck or shoulders more or less to the waistline, with or without a collar and sleeves, worn inside or outside a skirt, slacks, etc.
bust: a sculptured, painted, drawn, or engraved representation of the upper part of the human figure, especially a portrait sculpture showing only the head and shoulders of the subject.
peasant: a member of a class of persons, as in Europe, Asia, and Latin America, who are small farmers or farm laborers of low social rank.
gown: a woman's dress or robe, especially one that is full-length.
unify: to make or become a single unit; unite: to unify conflicting theories; to unify a country.
amenable: ready or willing to answer, act, agree, or yield; open to influence, persuasion, or advice; agreeable; submissive; tractable: an amenable servant.
cosmetic: a powder, lotion, lipstick, rouge, or other preparation for beautifying the face, skin, hair, nails, etc.
arrest: to seize (a person) by legal authority or warrant; take into custody: The police arrested the burglar.
thank: to express gratitude, appreciation, or acknowledgment to: She thanked them for their hospitality.
frighten: to make afraid or fearful; throw into a fright; terrify; scare.
teach: to impart knowledge of or skill in; give instruction in: She teaches mathematics.
conversion: the act or process of converting; state of being converted.
touchdown: Football. an act or instance of scoring six points by being in possession of the ball on or behind the opponent's goal line.
investigate: to examine, study, or inquire into systematically; search or examine into the particulars of; examine in detail.
genetics: Biology. the science of heredity, dealing with resemblances and differences of related organisms resulting from the interaction of their genes and the environment.
rescue: to free or deliver from confinement, violence, danger, or evil.
shallow: of little depth; not deep: shallow water.
clemency: the quality of being clement; disposition to show forbearance, compassion, or forgiveness in judging or punishing; leniency; mercy.
repeal: to revoke or withdraw formally or officially: to repeal a grant.
unfair: not fair; not conforming to approved standards, as of justice, honesty, or ethics: an unfair law; an unfair wage policy.
equitable: characterized by equity or fairness; just and right; fair; reasonable: equitable treatment of all citizens.
duel: a prearranged combat between two persons, fought with deadly weapons according to an accepted code of procedure, especially to settle a private quarrel.
harmonize: to bring into harmony, accord, or agreement: to harmonize one's views with the new situation.
regulate: to control or direct by a rule, principle, method, etc.: to regulate household expenses.
ingenuity: the quality of being cleverly inventive or resourceful; inventiveness: a designer of great ingenuity.
contrived: obviously planned or forced; artificial; strained: a contrived story.
nicety: a delicate or fine point; punctilio: niceties of protocol.
experimentation: the act, process, practice, or an instance of making experiments.
homogeneous: composed of parts or elements that are all of the same kind; not heterogeneous: a homogeneous population.
massachusetts: a state in the NE United States, on the Atlantic coast. 8257 sq. mi. (21,385 sq. km). Capital:  Boston.
consuming: strongly and urgently felt: a consuming need to be successful.
destruction: the act of destroying: wanton destruction of a town.
handling: a touching, grasping, or using with the hands.
collaborate: to work, one with another; cooperate, as on a literary work: They collaborated on a novel.
gallery: a raised area, often having a stepped or sloping floor, in a theater, church, or other public building to accommodate spectators, exhibits, etc.
caryl: a male or female given name.
feminist: advocating social, political, legal, and economic rights for women equal to those of men.
dissatisfaction: the state or attitude of not being satisfied; discontent; displeasure.
truck: any of various forms of vehicle for carrying goods and materials, usually consisting of a single self-propelled unit but also often composed of a trailer vehicle hauled by a tractor unit.
groundwork: foundation or basis: He laid the groundwork for an international conference.
accessible: easy to approach, reach, enter, speak with, or use.
congregation: an assembly of persons brought together for common religious worship.
port: a city, town, or other place where ships load or unload.
seacoast: the land immediately adjacent to the sea.
seagoing: designed or fit for going to sea, as a vessel.

windstorm: a storm with heavy wind but little or no precipitation.
rupture: the act of breaking or bursting: The flood led to the rupture of the dam.
rebound: to bound or spring back from force of impact.
duress: compulsion by threat or force; coercion; constraint.
passport: an official document issued by the government of a country to one of its citizens and, varying from country to country, authorizing travel to foreign countries and authenticating the bearer's identity, citizenship, right to protection while abroad, and right to reenter his or her native country.
sept: (in Scotland) a branch of a clan.
sep: Simplified Employee Pension: a tax-deferred pension plan for companies with 25 or fewer employees or for self-employed persons, in which an IRA is funded by employer and employee contributions.
varnish: a preparation consisting of resinous matter, as copal or lac, dissolved in an oil (oil varnish) or in alcohol (spirit varnish) or other volatile liquid. When applied to the surface of wood, metal, etc., it dries and leaves a hard, more or less glossy, usually transparent coating.
motivate: to provide with a motive or motives; incite; impel.
quit: to stop, cease, or discontinue: She quit what she was doing to help me paint the house.
submission: an act or instance of submitting.
thrifty: practicing thrift or economical management; frugal: a thrifty shopper.
frugality: the quality of being frugal, or prudent in saving; the lack of wastefulness: Many people who have lived through periods of economic deprivation develop lifelong habits of frugality and are almost never tempted by wasteful consumption.
shipper: a person who ships goods or makes shipments.
pet: any domesticated or tamed animal that is kept as a companion and cared for affectionately.
geography: the science dealing with the areal differentiation of the earth's surface, as shown in the character, arrangement, and interrelations over the world of such elements as climate, elevation, soil, vegetation, population, land use, industries, or states, and of the unit areas formed by the complex of these individual elements.
generation: the entire body of individuals born and living at about the same time: the postwar generation.
brussels: a city in and the capital of Belgium, in the central part.

slavic: a branch of the Indo-European family of languages, usually divided into East Slavic (Russian, Ukrainian, Byelorussian), West Slavic (Polish, Czech, Slovak, Sorbian), and South Slavic (Old Church Slavonic, Macedonian, Bulgarian, Serbo-Croatian, Slovene). Abbr.: Slav.
andrew: one of the 12 apostles of Jesus. Mark 3:18; John 1:40–42.
jackson: Andrew ("Old Hickory") 1767–1845, U.S. general: 7th president of the U.S. 1829–37.
maze: a confusing network of intercommunicating paths or passages; labyrinth.
rhyme: identity in sound of some part, especially the end, of words or lines of verse.
heighten: to increase the height of; make higher.
daughter: a female child or person in relation to her parents.
credit: commendation or honor given for some action, quality, etc.: Give credit where it is due.
driver: a person or thing that drives.

saying: something said, especially a proverb or apothegm.

abolition: the act of abolishing: the abolition of war.

trojan: of or relating to ancient Troy or its inhabitants.

ceremonial: of, relating to, or characterized by ceremony; formal; ritual: a ceremonial occasion.

gratifying: tending to gratify; giving or causing satisfaction; pleasing.
inference: the act or process of inferring.
commodity: an article of trade or commerce, especially a product as distinguished from a service.

picnic: an excursion or outing in which the participants carry food with them and share a meal in the open air.
lively: full or suggestive of life or vital energy; active, vigorous, or brisk: a lively discussion.

holy: specially recognized as or declared sacred by religious use or authority; consecrated: holy ground.

hindi: the most widely spoken of the modern Indic vernaculars, especially its best-known variety, Western Hindi.
bharat: Hindi name of the republic of India.
colony: a group of people who leave their native country to form in a new land a settlement subject to, or connected with, the parent nation.
commonwealth: (initial capital letter) a group of sovereign states and their dependencies associated by their own choice and linked with common objectives and interests: the British Commonwealth.
delhi: a union territory in N India. 574 sq. mi. (1487 sq. km).
hardening: a material that hardens another, as an alloy added to iron to make steel.
soluble: capable of being dissolved or liquefied: a soluble powder.
waistband: a band encircling the waist, especially as a part of a skirt or pair of trousers.
unless: except under the circumstances that: I'll be there at nine, unless the train is late.
insulator: No alarm from the insulator had come, yet for myself I had not forgotten that Venus girl outside.

par: an equality in value or standing; a level of equality: The gains and the losses are on a par.
fig: any tree or shrub belonging to the genus Ficus, of the mulberry family, especially a small tree, F. carica, native to southwestern Asia, bearing a turbinate or pear-shaped fruit that is eaten fresh, preserved, or dried.

myself: (used as an intensive of me or I): I myself will challenge the winner.

discriminatory: characterized by or showing prejudicial treatment, especially as an indication of bias related to age, color, national origin, religion, sex, etc.: discriminatory practices in housing; a discriminatory tax.
minority: the smaller part or number; a number, part, or amount forming less than half of the whole.
saddle: a seat for a rider on the back of a horse or other animal.

fermentation: the act or process of fermenting.
entertain: to hold the attention of pleasantly or agreeably; divert; amuse.
cheerful: full of cheer; in good spirits: a cheerful person.
witty: possessing wit in speech or writing; amusingly clever in perception and expression: a witty writer.
fancy: imagination or fantasy, especially as exercised in a capricious manner.
fancied: unreal; imaginary: to be upset by fancied grievances.
canid: any animal of the dog family Canidae, including the wolves, jackals, hyenas, coyotes, foxes, and domestic dogs.
restore: to bring back into existence, use, or the like; reestablish: to restore order.
vitality: exuberant physical strength or mental vigor: a person of great vitality.
nap: to sleep for a short time; doze.
apparel: clothing, especially outerwear; garments; attire; raiment.
slit: to cut apart or open along a line; make a long cut, fissure, or opening in.
ribbon: a woven strip or band of fine material, as silk or rayon, varying in width and finished off at the edges, used for ornament, tying, etc.
oak: any tree or shrub belonging to the genus Quercus, of the beech family, bearing the acorn as fruit.
inflammable: capable of being set on fire; combustible; flammable.
unctuous: characterized by excessive piousness or moralistic fervor, especially in an affected manner; excessively smooth, suave, or smug.
ether: Also called diethyl ether, diethyl oxide, ethyl ether, ethyl oxide, sulfuric ether. Chemistry, Pharmacology. a colorless, highly volatile, flammable liquid, C 4 H 10 O, having an aromatic odor and sweet, burning taste, derived from ethyl alcohol by the action of sulfuric acid: used as a solvent and, formerly, as an inhalant anesthetic.
evolve: to develop gradually: to evolve a scheme.
kindle: to start (a fire); cause (a flame, blaze, etc.) to begin burning.
brewing: the act of a person who brews.
decoct: to extract the flavor or essence of by boiling.
infuse: to introduce, as if by pouring; cause to penetrate; instill (usually followed by into): The energetic new principal infused new life into the school.
ovule: A careful longitudinal section of the scale through the ovule will show the general structure.
rudimentary: pertaining to rudiments or first principles; elementary: a rudimentary knowledge of geometry.
nutritious: providing nourishment, especially to a high degree; nourishing; healthful: a good, nutritious meal.
legume: any plant of the legume family, especially those used for feed, food, or as a soil-improving crop.
survey: to take a general or comprehensive view of or appraise, as a situation, area of study, etc.
heath: a tract of open and uncultivated land; wasteland overgrown with shrubs.
vapid: lacking or having lost life, sharpness, or flavor; insipid; flat: vapid tea.
bubble: a nearly spherical body of gas contained in a liquid.
sprinkle: to scatter (a liquid, powder, etc.) in drops or particles: She sprinkled powder on the baby.
hoe: a long-handled implement having a thin, flat blade usually set transversely, used to break up the surface of the ground, destroy weeds, etc.
hundred: a cardinal number, ten times ten.
exhale: to emit breath or vapor; breathe out.
atmospheric: pertaining to, existing in, or consisting of the atmosphere: atmospheric vapors.
irritating: causing irritation; annoying; provoking: irritating questions.

fume: Often, fumes. any smokelike or vaporous exhalation from matter or substances, especially of an odorous or harmful nature: tobacco fumes; noxious fumes of carbon monoxide.

absorbent: capable of absorbing heat, light, moisture, etc.; tending to absorb.
mix: to combine (substances, elements, things, etc.) into one mass, collection, or assemblage, generally with a thorough blending of the constituents.
pungent: sharply affecting the organs of taste or smell, as if by a penetrating power; biting; acrid.
nh: New Hampshire (approved especially for use with zip code).
refrigeration: the act or process of refrigerating.
pentavalent: having a valence of 5: pentavalent arsenic.
behalf: in / on behalf of, as a representative of or a proxy for: On behalf of my colleagues, I address you tonight.
hong: (in China) a group of rooms or buildings forming a warehouse, factory, etc.
precipitate: to hasten the occurrence of; bring about prematurely, hastily, or suddenly: to precipitate an international crisis.
cat: a small domesticated carnivore, Felis domestica or F. catus, bred in a number of varieties.
tallahassee: a city in and the capital of Florida, in the N part.
wallpaper: paper, usually with printed decorative patterns in color, for pasting on and covering the walls or ceilings of rooms, hallways, etc.
textile: any cloth or goods produced by weaving, knitting, or felting.
tympanic: pertaining or belonging to a tympanum.
chime: an apparatus for striking a bell so as to produce a musical sound, as one at the front door of a house by which visitors announce their presence.
rapture: ecstatic joy or delight; joyful ecstasy.
invasion: an act or instance of invading or entering as an enemy, especially by an army.
pathogenic: Pathology. capable of producing disease: pathogenic bacteria.
dental: of or relating to the teeth.
infect: to affect or contaminate (a person, organ, wound, etc.) with disease-producing germs.
radioactivity: the phenomenon, exhibited by and being a property of certain elements, of spontaneously emitting radiation resulting from changes in the nuclei of atoms of the element.
virtually: for the most part; almost wholly; just about: He is virtually unknown.
useless: of no use; not serving the purpose or any purpose; unavailing or futile: It is useless to reason with him.

gun: a weapon consisting of a metal tube, with mechanical attachments, from which projectiles are shot by the force of an explosive; a piece of ordnance.
grenade: a small shell containing an explosive and thrown by hand or fired from a rifle or launching device.
cartouche: Architecture. a rounded, convex surface, usually surrounded with carved ornamental scrollwork, for receiving a painted or low-relief decoration, as an escutcheon.
pasteboard: a stiff, firm board made of sheets of paper pasted or layers of paper pulp pressed together.
shot: a discharge of a firearm, bow, etc.
lung: either of the two saclike respiratory organs in the thorax of humans and the higher vertebrates.
aries: Astronomy. the Ram, a zodiacal constellation between Pisces and Taurus.
stack: a more or less orderly pile or heap: a precariously balanced stack of books; a neat stack of papers.
facilitate: to make easier or less difficult; help forward (an action, a process, etc.): Careful planning facilitates any kind of work.
shirt: a long- or short-sleeved garment for the upper part of the body, usually lightweight and having a collar and a front opening.
neckline: the opening at the neck of a garment, especially of a woman's garment, with reference to its shape or its position on the body: a V-neckline; a high neckline.
fold: to bend (cloth, paper, etc.) over upon itself.
operative: a person engaged, employed, or skilled in some branch of work, especially productive or industrial work; worker.
toe: one of the terminal digits of the human foot.
overhang: to hang or be suspended over: A great chandelier overhung the ballroom.
protrusion: the act of protruding or the state of being protruded.
jut: to extend beyond the main body or line; project; protrude (often followed by out): The narrow strip of land juts out into the bay.
rugged: having a roughly broken, rocky, hilly, or jagged surface: rugged ground.
beach: an expanse of sand or pebbles along a shore.
irregularity: the quality or state of being irregular.
wheeled: equipped with or having wheels (often used in combination): a four-wheeled carriage.
tropic: He did a comic turn in tropic Thunder and a quirky commercial for Jimmy Kimmel that aired during the Oscars.
submit: to give over or yield to the power or authority of another (often used reflexively).
obedient: obeying or willing to obey; complying with or submissive to authority: an obedient son.
bravery: brave spirit or conduct; courage; valor.
timorous: full of fear; fearful: The noise made them timorous.
ting: to make or cause to make a high, clear, ringing sound.
transfer: to convey or remove from one place, person, etc., to another: He transferred the package from one hand to the other.
demolish: to destroy or ruin (a building or other structure), especially on purpose; tear down; raze.
ruin: ruins, the remains of a building, city, etc., that has been destroyed or that is in disrepair or a state of decay: We visited the ruins of ancient Greece.
annihilate: to reduce to utter ruin or nonexistence; destroy utterly: The heavy bombing almost annihilated the city.
graduate: a person who has received a degree or diploma on completing a course of study, as in a university, college, or school.
engineering: the art or science of making practical application of the knowledge of pure sciences, as physics or chemistry, as in the construction of engines, bridges, buildings, mines, ships, and chemical plants.
undergraduate: a student in a university or college who has not received a first, especially a bachelor's, degree.
intellectual: appealing to or engaging the intellect: intellectual pursuits.

evolution: any process of formation or growth; development: the evolution of a language; the evolution of the airplane.
