agenda: a list, plan, outline, or the like, of things to be done, matters to be acted or voted upon, etc.: The chairman says we have a lengthy agenda this afternoon.
waterproofing: a substance by which something is made waterproof.
uintaite: an extremely pure asphalt particularly valuable for the manufacture of paints and varnishes.
weld: to unite or fuse (as pieces of metal) by hammering, compressing, or the like, especially after rendering soft or pasty by heat, and sometimes with the addition of fusible material like or unlike the pieces to be united.
fragrance: the quality of being fragrant; a sweet or pleasing scent.
toxin: any poison produced by an organism, characterized by antigenicity in certain animals and high molecular weight, and including the bacterial toxins that are the causative agents of tetanus, diphtheria, etc., and such plant and animal toxins as ricin and snake venom.
remedial: affording remedy; tending to remedy something.
evaporate: to change from a liquid or solid state into vapor; pass off in vapor. Synonyms: vaporize.
boggy: containing or full of bogs: It was difficult walking through the boggy terrain.
cultivate: to prepare and work on (land) in order to raise crops; till.
rubbish: worthless, unwanted material that is rejected or thrown out; debris; litter; trash.
depth: a dimension taken through an object or body of material, usually downward from an upper surface, horizontally inward from an outer surface, or from top to bottom of something regarded as one of several layers.
shrimp: any of several small, long-tailed, chiefly marine crustaceans of the decapod suborder Natania, certain species of which are used as food.
dives: the rich man of the parable in Luke 16:19–31.
puncture: the act of piercing or perforating, as with a pointed instrument or object.
necklace: a piece of jewelry consisting of a string of stones, beads, jewels, or the like, or a chain of gold, silver, or other metal, for wearing around the neck.
unruly: not submissive or conforming to rule; ungovernable; turbulent; intractable; refractory; lawless: an unruly class; an unruly wilderness.
punish: to subject to pain, loss, confinement, death, etc., as a penalty for some offense, transgression, or fault: to punish a criminal.
clean: free from dirt; unsoiled; unstained: She bathed and put on a clean dress.
voltaic: Electricity. noting or pertaining to electricity or electric currents, especially when produced by chemical action, as in a cell; galvanic.
indoor: occurring, used, etc., in a house or building, rather than out of doors: indoor games.
gnaw: to bite or chew on, especially persistently.
obtuse: not quick or alert in perception, feeling, or intellect; not sensitive or observant; dull.
kinetics: the branch of mechanics that deals with the actions of forces in producing or changing the motion of masses.
statics: the branch of mechanics that deals with bodies at rest or forces in equilibrium.
kinematics: the branch of mechanics that deals with pure motion, without reference to the masses or forces involved in it.
outlet: an opening or passage by which anything is let out; vent; exit.
outpouring: something that pours out or is poured out; an outflow, overflow, or effusion: an outpouring of sympathy from her friends.
stair: one of a flight or series of steps for going from one level to another, as in a building.
augusta: a city in E Georgia, on the Savannah River.
smear: to spread or daub (an oily, greasy, viscous, or wet substance) on or over something: to smear butter on bread.
semisolid: having a somewhat firm consistency; more or less solid.
copal: a hard, lustrous resin obtained from various tropical trees and used chiefly in making varnishes.
polymerization: the act or process of forming a polymer or polymeric compound.
polyethylene: a plastic polymer of ethylene used chiefly for containers, electrical insulation, and packaging.
condensation: the act of condensing; the state of being condensed.
polyhydroxy: containing two or more hydroxyl groups.
hydrolysis: chemical decomposition in which a compound is split into other compounds by reacting with water.
curd: Often, curds. a substance consisting mainly of casein and the like, obtained from milk by coagulation, and used as food or made into cheese.
whey: a milk serum, separating as liquid from the curd after coagulation, as in cheese making.
poster: a placard or bill posted or intended for posting in a public place, as for advertising.
inventor: a person who invents, especially one who devises some new process, appliance, machine, or article; one who makes inventions.
inform: to give or impart knowledge of a fact or circumstance to: He informed them of his arrival.
assured: guaranteed; sure; certain; secure: an assured income.
everything: every, thing or particular of an aggregate or total; all.
urea: Biochemistry. a compound, CO(NH 2) 2 , occurring in urine and other body fluids as a product of protein metabolism.
carbolic: of or derived from carbolic acid.
oh: (used as an expression of surprise, pain, disapprobation, etc.)
disinfectant: any chemical agent used chiefly on inanimate objects to destroy or inhibit the growth of harmful organisms.
isomeric: of, relating to, or displaying isomerism.
formula: a set form of words, as for stating or declaring something definitely or authoritatively, for indicating procedure to be followed, or for prescribed use on some ceremonial occasion.
aqueous: of, like, or containing water; watery: an aqueous solution.
mold: a hollow form or matrix for giving a particular shape to something in a molten or plastic state.
univalent: Chemistry. having a valence of one; monovalent.
saturated: soaked, impregnated, or imbued thoroughly; charged thoroughly or completely; brought to a state of saturation.
magnesium: a light, ductile, silver-white, metallic element that burns with a dazzling white light, used in lightweight alloys, flares, fireworks, in the manufacture of flashbulbs, optical mirrors, and precision instruments, and as a zinc substitute in batteries. Symbol:  Mg; atomic weight:  24.312; atomic number:  12; specific gravity:  1.74 at 20°C.
lithium: Chemistry. a soft, silver-white metallic element, the lightest of all metals, occurring combined in certain minerals. Symbol:  Li; atomic weight:  6.939; atomic number:  3; specific gravity:  0.53 at 20°C.
isinglass: a pure, transparent or translucent form of gelatin, obtained from the air bladders of certain fish, especially the sturgeon: used in glue and jellies and as a clarifying agent.
vitrify: to convert or be converted into glass.
intact: not altered, broken, or impaired; remaining uninjured, sound, or whole; untouched; unblemished: The vase remained intact despite rough handling.
decompose: to separate or resolve into constituent parts or elements; disintegrate: The bacteria decomposed the milk into its solid and liquid elements.
prolific: producing offspring, young, fruit, etc., abundantly; highly fruitful: a prolific pear tree.
buoyant: tending to float in a fluid.
amazing: causing great surprise or sudden wonder.
piston: a disk or cylindrical part tightly fitting and moving within a cylinder, either to compress or move a fluid collected in the cylinder, as air or water, or to transform energy imparted by a fluid entering or expanding inside the cylinder, as compressed air, explosive gases, or steam, into a rectilinear motion usually transformed into rotary motion by means of a connecting rod.
plunger: Machinery. a pistonlike reciprocating part moving within the cylinder of a pump or hydraulic device.
coronation: the act or ceremony of crowning a king, queen, or other sovereign.
crew: a group of persons involved in a particular kind of work or working together: the crew of a train; a wrecking crew.
inserted: Botany. (especially of the parts of a flower) attached to or growing out of some part.
kill: to deprive of life in any manner; cause the death of; slay. Synonyms: slaughter, massacre, butcher; hang, electrocute, behead, guillotine, strangle, garrote; assassinate.
detonate: to explode with suddenness and violence.
artillery: mounted projectile-firing guns or missile launchers, mobile or stationary, light or heavy, as distinguished from small arms.
windshield: a shield of glass, in one or more sections, projecting above and across the dashboard of an automobile.
rhombic: having the form of a rhombus.
burns: Arthur F(rank) 1904–1987, U.S. economist, born in Austria: chairman of the Federal Reserve Board 1970–78.
firework: Often, fireworks. a combustible or explosive device for producing a striking display of light or a loud noise, used for signaling or as part of a celebration.
caroline: of or relating to Charles, especially Charles I and Charles II of England or their times.
majestic: characterized by or possessing majesty; of lofty dignity or imposing aspect; stately; grand: the majestic Alps.
magnificence: the quality or state of being magnificent; splendor; grandeur; sublimity: the magnificence of snow-covered mountains; the magnificence of his achievements.
philosophical: of or relating to philosophy: philosophical studies.
repel: to drive or force back (an assailant, invader, etc.).
pennsylvania: a state in the E United States. 45,333 sq. mi. (117,410 sq. km). Capital:  Harrisburg.
susquehanna: a river flowing S from central New York through E Pennsylvania and NE Maryland into Chesapeake Bay. 444 miles (715 km) long.
deficient: lacking some element or characteristic; defective: deficient in taste.
ethane: a colorless, odorless, flammable gas, C 2 H 6 , of the methane series, present in natural gas, illuminating gas, and crude petroleum: used chiefly in organic synthesis and as a fuel gas.
vinegar: a sour liquid consisting of dilute and impure acetic acid, obtained by acetous fermentation from wine, cider, beer, ale, or the like: used as a condiment, preservative, etc.
tart: sharp to the taste; sour or acid: Tart apples are best for pie.
neutralize: to make neutral; cause to undergo neutralization.
redden: to make or cause to become red.
indicator: a person or thing that indicates.
baryon: a proton, neutron, or any elementary particle that decays into a set of particles that includes a proton.
arsenic: a grayish-white element having a metallic luster, vaporizing when heated, and forming poisonous compounds. Symbol:  As; atomic weight:  74.92; atomic number:  33.
wash: to apply water or some other liquid to (something or someone) for the purpose of cleansing; cleanse by dipping, rubbing, or scrubbing in water or some other liquid.
activate: to make active; cause to function or act.
velvety: suggestive of or resembling velvet; smooth; soft: velvety rose petals; a velvety voice; a velvety cream sauce.
texas: a deckhouse on a texas deck for the accommodation of officers.
separator: a person or thing that separates.
electrolytic: pertaining to or derived by electrolysis.
generator: a machine that converts one form of energy into another, especially mechanical energy into electrical energy, as a dynamo, or electrical energy into sound, as an acoustic generator.
lighting: the act of igniting or illuminating: the lighting of many candles; the annual lighting of the Christmas tree.
rebekah: the sister of Laban, wife of Isaac, and mother of Esau and Jacob. Gen. 24–27.
lepton: an aluminum coin of modern Greece until the euro was adopted, the 100th part of a drachma.
unstable: not stable; not firm or firmly fixed; unsteady.
antiparticle: a particle all of whose properties, as mass, spin, or charge, have the same magnitude as but, where appropriate, the opposite sign of a specific elementary particle; neutral pions, photons, and gravitons are considered to be their own antiparticles: The positron is the antiparticle of the electron.
meson: Physics. any hadron, or strongly interacting particle, other than a baryon. Mesons are bosons, having spins of 0, 1, 2, …, and, unlike baryons, do not obey a conservation law.
strangeness: the quality or condition of being strange.
naturalize: to confer upon (an alien) the rights and privileges of a citizen.
citizenship: the state of being vested with the rights, privileges, and duties of a citizen.
denmark: a kingdom in N Europe, on the Jutland peninsula and adjacent islands. 16,576 sq. mi. (42,930 sq. km). Capital:  Copenhagen.
juneau: a seaport in and the capital of Alaska, in the SE part.
northeast: a point on the compass midway between north and east. Abbreviation:  NE.
encomium: a formal expression of high praise; eulogy: An encomium by the president greeted the returning hero.
tribute: a gift, testimonial, compliment, or the like, given as due or in acknowledgment of gratitude or esteem.
renew: to begin or take up again, as an acquaintance, a conversation, etc.; resume.
receipt: a written acknowledgment of having received, or taken into one's possession, a specified amount of money, goods, etc.
constant: not changing or varying; uniform; regular; invariable: All conditions during the three experiments were constant.
disregard: to pay no attention to; leave out of consideration; ignore: Disregard the footnotes.
dismiss: to direct (an assembly of persons) to disperse or go: I dismissed the class early.
matrimony: the state of being married; marriage: He was married in 1870 and lived in matrimony 12 years.
delineate: to trace the outline of; sketch or trace in outline; represent pictorially: He delineated the state of Texas on the map with a red pencil.
rub: to subject the surface of (a thing or person) to pressure and friction, as in cleaning, smoothing, polishing, coating, massaging, or soothing: to rub a table top with wax polish; to rub the entire back area.
seductive: tending to seduce; enticing; beguiling; captivating: a seductive smile.
maggie: a female given name, form of Margaret.
fiery: consisting of, attended with, characterized by, or containing fire: a volcano's fiery discharge.
dowager: a woman who holds some title or property from her deceased husband, especially the widow of a king, duke, etc. (often used as an additional title to differentiate her from the wife of the present king, duke, etc.): a queen dowager; an empress dowager.
countess: the wife or widow of a count in the nobility of Continental Europe or of an earl in the British peerage.
confidante: a woman to whom secrets are confided or with whom private matters and problems are discussed.
lady: a woman who is refined, polite, and well-spoken: She may be poor and have little education, but she's a real lady.
shackleton: Sir Ernest Henry, 1874–1922, English explorer of the Antarctic.
harriet: a female given name, form of Harry.
walters: Barbara, born 1931, U.S. reporter and television interviewer.
reims: a city in NE France: cathedral; unconditional surrender of Germany May 7, 1945.
cathedral: the principal church of a diocese, containing the bishop's throne.
descendant: a person or animal that is descended from a specific ancestor; an offspring.
semitic: a subfamily of Afroasiatic languages that includes Akkadian, Arabic, Aramaic, Ethiopic, Hebrew, and Phoenician.
arabia: a peninsula in SW Asia, including Saudi Arabia, Yemen Arab Republic, People's Democratic Republic of Yemen, Oman, the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, and Kuwait: divided in ancient times into Arabia Deserta, Arabia Petraea, and Arabia Felix. About 1,000,000 sq. mi. (2,600,000 sq. km).
scone: a small, light, biscuitlike quick bread made of oatmeal, wheat flour, barley meal, or the like.
impairment: the state of being diminished, weakened, or damaged, especially mentally or physically: cognitive impairment in older adults.
equanimity: mental or emotional stability or composure, especially under tension or strain; calmness; equilibrium.
forbear: to refrain or abstain from; desist from.
irritate: to excite to impatience or anger; annoy.
hint: an indirect, covert, or helpful suggestion; clue: Give me a hint as to his identity.
prejudice: an unfavorable opinion or feeling formed beforehand or without knowledge, thought, or reason.
mitigate: to lessen in force or intensity, as wrath, grief, harshness, or pain; moderate.
transgress: to violate a law, command, moral code, etc.; offend; sin.
raider: a person or thing that raids.
logotype: Also called logo. a single piece of type bearing two or more uncombined letters, a syllable, or a word.
jubilant: showing great joy, satisfaction, or triumph; rejoicing; exultant: the cheers of the jubilant victors; the jubilant climax of his symphony.
sad: affected by unhappiness or grief; sorrowful or mournful: to feel sad because a close friend has moved away.
blameworthy: deserving blame; blameful: a blameworthy administration.
motive: something that causes a person to act in a certain way, do a certain thing, etc.; incentive.
impel: to drive or urge forward; press on; incite or constrain to action.
dictate: to say or read (something) aloud for another person to transcribe or for a machine to record: to dictate some letters to a secretary.
penitent: feeling or expressing sorrow for sin or wrongdoing and disposed to atonement and amendment; repentant; contrite.
repentance: deep sorrow, compunction, or contrition for a past sin, wrongdoing, or the like.
sympathize: to be in sympathy or agreement of feeling; share in a feeling (often followed by with).
continuity: the state or quality of being continuous.
uniformity: the state or quality of being uniform; overall sameness, homogeneity, or regularity: uniformity of style.
unsettled: not settled; not fixed or stable; without established order; unorganized; disorganized: an unsettled social order; still unsettled in their new home.
cyclone: Compare anticyclone, extratropical cyclone, tropical cyclone.
typhoon: a tropical cyclone or hurricane of the western Pacific area and the China seas.
reproof: the act of reproving, censuring, or rebuking.
adequacy: the state or quality of being adequate; sufficiency for a particular purpose.
accountant: a person whose profession is inspecting and auditing personal or commercial accounts.
hector: Classical Mythology. the eldest son of Priam and husband of Andromache: the greatest Trojan hero in the Trojan War, killed by Achilles.
authorize: to give authority or official power to; empower: to authorize an employee to sign purchase orders.
telegraphic: of or relating to the telegraph.
inductive: of, relating to, or involving electrical induction or magnetic induction.
coupling: the act of a person or thing that couples.
potential: possible, as opposed to actual: the potential uses of nuclear energy.
dissipated: indulging in or characterized by excessive devotion to pleasure; intemperate; dissolute.
watt: the standard unit of power in the International System of Units (SI), equivalent to one joule per second and equal to the power in a circuit in which a current of one ampere flows across a potential difference of one volt. Abbreviation:  W, w.
coulomb: the standard unit of quanitity of electricity in the International System of Units (SI), equal to the quantity of charge transferred in one second across a conductor in which there is a constant current of one ampere. Abbreviation:  C.
infinite: immeasurably great: an infinite capacity for forgiveness.
negligible: so small, trifling, or unimportant that it may safely be neglected or disregarded: The extra expenses were negligible.
newton: the standard unit of force in the International System of Units (SI), equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one meter per second per second on a mass of one kilogram. Abbreviation:  N.
slaughter: the killing or butchering of cattle, sheep, etc., especially for food.
personify: to attribute human nature or character to (an inanimate object or an abstraction), as in speech or writing.
electroplate: to plate or coat with a metal by electrolysis.
overspread: to spread or diffuse over: A blush of embarrassment overspread his face.
despise: to regard with contempt, distaste, disgust, or disdain; scorn; loathe.
wilderness: a wild and uncultivated region, as of forest or desert, uninhabited or inhabited only by wild animals; a tract of wasteland.
cud: the portion of food that a ruminant returns from the first stomach to the mouth to chew a second time.
conciliate: to overcome the distrust or hostility of; placate; win over: to conciliate an angry competitor.
overture: an opening or initiating move toward negotiations, a new relationship, an agreement, etc.; a formal or informal proposal or offer: overtures of peace; a shy man who rarely made overtures of friendship.
league: a covenant or compact made between persons, parties, states, etc., for the promotion or maintenance of common interests or for mutual assistance or service.
atlanta: a city in and the capital of Georgia, in the N part.
transcaucasia: a region in SE Europe, S of the Caucasus Mountains, between the Black and Caspian seas: constituted a republic 1922–36 (Transcauca·sian So·cialist Fed·erated So·viet Repub·lic) area now includes the republics of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia.
iran: a republic in SW Asia. About 635,000 sq. mi. (1,644,650 sq. km). Capital:  Teheran.
baku: a city in and the capital of Azerbaijan, in the E part, on the Caspian Sea.
translation: the rendering of something into another language or into one's own from another language.
strengthen: to make stronger; give strength to.
racehorse: a horse bred or kept for racing, especially in flat races or steeplechases.
yacht: a vessel used for private cruising, racing, or other noncommercial purposes.
pore: to read or study with steady attention or application: a scholar poring over a rare old manuscript.
porifera: an animal phylum comprising the sponges.
siliceous: containing, consisting of, or resembling silica.
sessile: Botany. attached by the base, or without any distinct projecting support, as a leaf issuing directly from the stem.
dicotyledonous: belonging or pertaining to the Dicotyledoneae; having two cotyledons.
plenipotentiary: a person, especially a diplomatic agent, invested with full power or authority to transact business on behalf of another.
farragut: David Glasgow, 1801–70, U.S. admiral: won the battles of New Orleans and Mobile Bay for the Union in the U.S. Civil War.
trousers: Compare Bermuda shorts, breeches, knickers (def 1), short (def 29a), slacks.
corded: furnished with, made of, or in the form of cords.
hornblende: a dark-green to black mineral of the amphibole group, calcium magnesium iron and hydroxyl aluminosilicate.
tremolite: a white or grayish variety of amphibole, Ca 2 Mg 5 Si 8 O 22 (OH) 2 , usually occurring in bladed crystals.
serpentine: of, characteristic of, or resembling a serpent, as in form or movement.
manipulate: to manage or influence skillfully, especially in an unfair manner: to manipulate people's feelings.
deciduous: shedding the leaves annually, as certain trees and shrubs.
hind: situated in the rear or at the back; posterior: the hind legs of an animal.
beef: the flesh of a cow, steer, or bull raised and killed for its meat.
ointment: a soft, unctuous preparation, often medicated, for application to the skin; unguent.
hexagonal: of, relating to, or having the form of a hexagon.
hive: a shelter constructed for housing a colony of honeybees; beehive.
pollen: the fertilizing element of flowering plants, consisting of fine, powdery, yellowish grains or spores, sometimes in masses.
fluorescent: possessing the property of fluorescence; exhibiting fluorescence.
grate: a frame of metal bars for holding fuel when burning, as in a fireplace, furnace, or stove.
fervor: great warmth and earnestness of feeling: to speak with great fervor.
diligence: constant and earnest effort to accomplish what is undertaken; persistent exertion of body or mind.
ardor: great warmth of feeling; fervor; passion: She spoke persuasively and with ardor.
persistent: persisting, especially in spite of opposition, obstacles, discouragement, etc.; persevering: a most annoyingly persistent young man.
buttons: a bellboy or page in a hotel.
boned: having a particular kind of bone or bony structure (used in combination): beautifully boned; raw-boned; small-boned.
slimmer: a person who is trying to lose weight, especially by dieting.
waistline: the circumference of the body at the waist: exercises to reduce the waistline.
slacks: men's or women's trousers for informal wear.
robe: a long, loose or flowing gown or outer garment worn by men or women as ceremonial dress, an official vestment, or garb of office.
persuasion: the act of persuading or seeking to persuade.
tractable: easily managed or controlled; docile; yielding: a tractable child; a tractable disposition.
teammate: a member of the same team.
lotion: Pharmacology. a liquid, usually aqueous or sometimes alcoholic preparation containing insoluble material in the form of a suspension or emulsion, intended for external application without rubbing, in such skin conditions as itching, infection, allergy, pain, or the like.
lipstick: a crayonlike oil-based cosmetic used in coloring the lips, usually in a tubular container.
rouge: any of various red cosmetics for coloring the cheeks or lips.
eyelash: one of the short, thick, curved hairs growing as a fringe on the edge of an eyelid.
justification: a reason, fact, circumstance, or explanation that justifies or defends: His insulting you was ample justification for you to leave the party.
juggle: to keep (several objects, as balls, plates, tenpins, or knives) in continuous motion in the air simultaneously by tossing and catching.
feat: a noteworthy or extraordinary act or achievement, usually displaying boldness, skill, etc.: Arranging the treaty was a diplomatic feat.
hospitality: the friendly reception and treatment of guests or strangers.
scare: to fill, especially suddenly, with fear or terror; frighten; alarm.
investment: the investing of money or capital in order to gain profitable returns, as interest, income, or appreciation in value.
drown: to die under water or other liquid of suffocation.
solicit: to seek for (something) by entreaty, earnest or respectful request, formal application, etc.: He solicited aid from the minister.
clement: mild or merciful in disposition or character; lenient; compassionate: A clement judge reduced his sentence.
forgiveness: act of forgiving; state of being forgiven.
leniency: the quality or state of being lenient.
deadly: causing or tending to cause death; fatal; lethal: a deadly poison.
quarrel: an angry dispute or altercation; a disagreement marked by a temporary or permanent break in friendly relations.
elucidate: to make lucid or clear; throw light upon; explain: an explanation that elucidated his recent strange behavior.
inventive: apt at inventing, devising, or contriving.
resourceful: able to deal skillfully and promptly with new situations, difficulties, etc.
designer: a person who devises or executes designs, especially one who creates forms, structures, and patterns, as for works of art or machines.
strained: affected or produced by effort; not natural or spontaneous; forced: strained hospitality.
punctilio: a fine point, particular, or detail, as of conduct, ceremony, or procedure.
protocol: the customs and regulations dealing with diplomatic formality, precedence, and etiquette.
blend: to mix smoothly and inseparably together: to blend the ingredients in a recipe.
wanton: done, shown, used, etc., maliciously or unjustifiably: a wanton attack; wanton cruelty.
gram: a metric unit of mass or weight equal to 15.432 grains; one thousandth of a kilogram. Abbreviation:  g.
obligate: to bind or oblige morally or legally: to obligate oneself to purchase a building.
seam: the line formed by sewing together pieces of cloth, leather, or the like.
muddle: to mix up in a confused or bungling manner; jumble.
tractor: a powerful motor-driven vehicle with large, heavy treads, used for pulling farm machinery, other vehicles, etc.
aisle: a walkway between or along sections of seats in a theater, classroom, or the like.
induce: to lead or move by persuasion or influence, as to some action or state of mind: to induce a person to buy a raffle ticket.
accumulate: to gather or collect, often in gradual degrees; heap up: to accumulate wealth.
reenter: to enter again: The guests reentered the reception room after dinner.
clan: a group of families or households, as among the Scottish Highlanders, the heads of which claim descent from a common ancestor: the Mackenzie clan.
ira: a male given name: from a Hebrew word meaning “watchful.”.
employer: a person or business that employs one or more people, especially for wages or salary: a fair employer.
practicing: actively working at a profession, especially medicine or law.
economical: avoiding waste or extravagance; thrifty: an economical meal; an economical use of interior space.
frugal: economical in use or expenditure; prudently saving or sparing; not wasteful: What your office needs is a frugal manager who can save you money without resorting to painful cutbacks.
wasteful: given to or characterized by useless consumption or expenditure: wasteful methods; a wasteful way of life.
finch: any of numerous small passerine birds of the family Fringillidae, including the buntings, sparrows, crossbills, purple finches, and grosbeaks, most of which have a short, conical bill adapted for eating seeds.
streak: a long, narrow mark, smear, band of color, or the like: streaks of mud.
differentiation: the act or process of differentiating, or the state of being differentiated.
legend: a nonhistorical or unverifiable story handed down by tradition from earlier times and popularly accepted as historical.
postwar: of, relating to, or characteristic of a period following a war: postwar problems; postwar removal of rationing.
linguistic: of or belonging to language: linguistic change.
palestine: Also called Holy Land. Biblical name Canaan. an ancient country in SW Asia, on the E coast of the Mediterranean.
abraham: the first of the great Biblical patriarchs, father of Isaac, and traditional founder of the ancient Hebrew nation: considered by Muslims an ancestor of the Arab peoples through his son Ishmael.
ukrainian: of or relating to Ukraine, its people, or their language.
byelorussian: of or relating to Byelorussia, its people, or their language.
czech: a member of the most westerly branch of the Slavs, comprising the Bohemians, or Czechs proper, and, sometimes, the Moravians.
slovak: one of a Slavic people dwelling in Slovakia.
sorbian: of or relating to the Wends or their language.
macedonian: a native or inhabitant of Macedonia.
bulgarian: Also, Bulgar. a native or inhabitant of Bulgaria.
slovene: one of a Slavic people dwelling in Slovenia.
slav: one of a group of peoples in eastern, southeastern, and central Europe, including the Russians and Ruthenians (Eastern Slavs) the Bulgars, Serbs, Croats, Slavonians, Slovenes, etc. (Southern Slavs) and the Poles, Czechs, Moravians, Slovaks, etc. (Western Slavs)
jew: one of a scattered group of people that traces its descent from the Biblical Hebrews or from postexilic adherents of Judaism; Israelite.
emigrant: a person who emigrates, as from his or her native country or region: They welcomed the emigrants from Italy.
facet: one of the small, polished plane surfaces of a cut gem.
labyrinth: an intricate combination of paths or passages in which it is difficult to find one's way or to reach the exit. Synonyms: maze, network, web.
unnilseptium: former name of bohrium. Symbol:  Uns.
apothegm: a short, pithy, instructive saying; a terse remark or aphorism.
shrewd: astute or sharp in practical matters: a shrewd politician.
snide: derogatory in a nasty, insinuating manner: snide remarks about his boss.
cronus: a Titan, son of Uranus and Gaea, who was dethroned by his son Zeus.
demeter: the ancient Greek chthonian goddess of agriculture and the protector of marriage and the social order, identified by the Romans with Ceres. She presided over the Eleusinian mysteries.
hades: Persephone snacked on pomegranate seeds in Hades and now our gas bills rocket in January.
hera: the ancient Greek queen of heaven, a daughter of Cronus and Rhea and the wife and sister of Zeus.
hestia: the ancient Greek goddess of the hearth.
poseidon: the ancient Greek god of the sea, with the power to cause earthquakes, identified by the Romans with Neptune.
tyndareus: the husband of Leda and father of Clytemnestra and Castor.
castor: Also, castoreum. a brownish, unctuous substance with a strong, penetrating odor, secreted by certain glands in the groin of the beaver, used in medicine and perfumery.
clytemnestra: the daughter of Tyndareus and Leda, the wife of Agamemnon, and the mother of Orestes, Electra, and Iphigenia. She killed Agamemnon and was herself killed, along with her lover, Aegisthus, by Orestes.
swan: Compare mute swan, trumpeter swan, whistling swan, whooper swan.
sparta: an ancient city in S Greece: the capital of Laconia and the chief city of the Peloponnesus, at one time the dominant city of Greece: famous for strict discipline and training of soldiers.
agamemnon: Classical Mythology. a king of Mycenae, a son of Atreus and brother of Menelaus. He led the Greeks in the Trojan War and was murdered by Clytemnestra, his wife, upon his return from Troy.
pilgrimage: a journey, especially a long one, made to some sacred place as an act of religious devotion: a pilgrimage to Lourdes.
sector: Geometry. a plane figure bounded by two radii and the included arc of a circle.
prophet: a person who speaks for God or a deity, or by divine inspiration.
wandering: moving from place to place without a fixed plan; roaming; rambling: wandering tourists.
lectern: a reading desk in a church on which the Bible rests and from which the lessons are read during the church service.
samuel: a judge and prophet of Israel. I Sam. 1–3; 8–15.
pectoral: of, in, on, or pertaining to the chest or breast; thoracic.
gratify: to give pleasure to (a person or persons) by satisfying desires or humoring inclinations or feelings: Her praise will gratify all who worked so hard to earn it.
preside: to occupy the place of authority or control, as in an assembly or meeting; act as president or chairperson.
crucial: involving an extremely important decision or result; decisive; critical: a crucial experiment.
excursion: a short trip or outing to some place, usually for a special purpose and with the intention of a prompt return: a pleasure excursion; a scientific excursion.
outing: a pleasure trip, excursion, picnic, or the like: the annual outing for the senior class.
export: to ship (commodities) to other countries or places for sale, exchange, etc.
explicate: to make plain or clear; explain; interpret.
parable: a short allegorical story designed to illustrate or teach some truth, religious principle, or moral lesson.
indic: of or relating to India; Indian.
venus: an ancient Italian goddess of gardens and spring, identified by the Romans with Aphrodite as the goddess of love and beauty.
curdle: to change into curd; coagulate; congeal.
congeal: to change from a soft or fluid state to a rigid or solid state, as by cooling or freezing: The fat congealed on the top of the soup.
euphorbia: any plant of the genus Euphorbia, comprising the spurges.
turbinate: Also, turbinated. having the shape of an inverted cone; scroll-like; whorled; spiraled.
adventitious: associated with something by chance rather than as an integral part; extrinsic.
crankcase: (in an internal-combustion engine) the housing that encloses the crankshaft, connecting rods, and allied parts.
intensive: of, relating to, or characterized by intensity: intensive questioning.
challenge: a call or summons to engage in any contest, as of skill, strength, etc.
peter: to diminish gradually and stop; dwindle to nothing: The hot water always peters out in the middle of my shower.
rib: one of a series of curved bones that are articulated with the vertebrae and occur in pairs, 12 in humans, on each side of the vertebrate body, certain pairs being connected with the sternum and forming the thoracic wall.
wit: the keen perception and cleverly apt expression of those connections between ideas that awaken amusement and pleasure. Synonyms: drollery, facetiousness, waggishness, repartee.
fantasy: imagination, especially when extravagant and unrestrained.
capricious: subject to, led by, or indicative of a sudden, odd notion or unpredictable change; erratic: He's such a capricious boss I never know how he'll react.
exuberant: effusively and almost uninhibitedly enthusiastic; lavishly abundant: an exuberant welcome for the hero.
attire: to dress, array, or adorn, especially for special occasions, ceremonials, etc.
outerwear: garments, as raincoats or overcoats, worn over other clothing for warmth or protection outdoors; overclothes.
quercus: Latin quercus "oak," from PIE *kwerkwu-, assimilated form of *perkwu- "oak" (see fir).
beech: any tree of the genus Fagus, of temperate regions, having a smooth gray bark and bearing small, edible, triangular nuts.
acorn: the typically ovoid fruit or nut of an oak, enclosed at the base by a cupule.
suave: (of persons or their manner, speech, etc.) smoothly agreeable or polite; agreeably or blandly urbane.
smug: contentedly confident of one's ability, superiority, or correctness; complacent.
pharmacology: the science dealing with the preparation, uses, and especially the effects of drugs.
inhalant: a medicine, allergen, or other substance that is inhaled.
anesthetic: a substance that produces anesthesia, as halothane, procaine, or ether.
anoint: to rub or sprinkle on; apply an unguent, ointment, or oily liquid to.
perfume: a substance, extract, or preparation for diffusing or imparting an agreeable or attractive smell, especially a fluid containing fragrant natural oils extracted from flowers, woods, etc., or similar synthetic oils.
lubricate: to apply some oily or greasy substance to (a machine, parts of a mechanism, etc.) in order to diminish friction; oil or grease (something).
blaze: a bright flame or fire: the welcome blaze of the hearth.
hop: to make a short, bouncing leap; move by leaping with all feet off the ground.
essence: the basic, real, and invariable nature of a thing or its significant individual feature or features: Freedom is the very essence of our democracy.
instill: to infuse slowly or gradually into the mind or feelings; insinuate; inject: to instill courtesy in a child.
fetus: (used chiefly of viviparous mammals) the young of an animal in the womb or egg, especially in the later stages of development when the body structures are in the recognizable form of its kind, in humans after the end of the second month of gestation.
ignore: to refrain from noticing or recognizing: to ignore insulting remarks.
appraise: to estimate the monetary value of; determine the worth of; assess: We had an expert appraise the house before we bought it.
drug: Pharmacology. a chemical substance used in the treatment, cure, prevention, or diagnosis of disease or used to otherwise enhance physical or mental well-being.
wasteland: land that is uncultivated or barren.
achene: any small, dry, hard, one-seeded, indehiscent fruit.
cherry: the fruit of any of various trees belonging to the genus Prunus, of the rose family, consisting of a pulpy, globular drupe enclosing a one-seeded smooth stone.
irritation: the act of irritating or the state of being irritated.
vaporous: having the form or characteristics of vapor: a vaporous cloud.
monoxide: an oxide containing one oxygen atom in each molecule.
wipe: to rub lightly with or on a cloth, towel, paper, the hand, etc., in order to clean or dry the surface of: He wiped the furniture with a damp cloth.
biting: nipping; smarting; keen: biting cold; a biting sensation on the tongue.
suffocate: to kill by preventing the access of air to the blood through the lungs or analogous organs, as gills; strangle.
hampshire: Also called Hants. a county in S England. 1460 sq. mi. (3780 sq. km).
reagent: a substance that, because of the reactions it causes, is used in analysis and synthesis.
proxy: the agency, function, or power of a person authorized to act as the deputy or substitute for another.
warehouse: a building, or a part of one, for the storage of goods, merchandise, etc.
hasten: to move or act with haste; proceed with haste; hurry: to hasten to a place.
sink: to displace part of the volume of a supporting substance or object and become totally or partially submerged or enveloped; fall or descend into or below the surface or to the bottom (often followed by in or into): The battleship sank within two hours. His foot sank in the mud. Her head sinks into the pillows.
felis: a genus of mostly small cats, including the domestic cat, margay, puma, and ocelot, sharing with certain cats of related genera an inability to roar due to ossification of the hyoid bone in the larynx.
insubstantial: not substantial or real; lacking substance: an insubstantial world of dreams.
tympanum: Atmospheric pressure is increasing, and I feel as if my tympanum were breaking.
pathology: the science or the study of the origin, nature, and course of diseases.
outgas: to remove (adsorbed or occluded gases), usually by heat or reduced pressure.
futile: incapable of producing any result; ineffective; useless; not successful: Attempting to force-feed the sick horse was futile.
accelerate: to cause faster or greater activity, development, progress, advancement, etc., in: to accelerate economic growth.
appendix: supplementary material at the end of a book, article, document, or other text, usually of an explanatory, statistical, or bibliographic nature. Synonyms: addendum, adjunct, appurtenance; addition, supplement.
illustration: something that illustrates, as a picture in a book or magazine.
scrollwork: decorative work in which scroll forms figure prominently.
escutcheon: a shield or shieldlike surface on which a coat of arms is depicted.
respiratory: pertaining to or serving for respiration: respiratory disease.
pisces: Astronomy. the Fishes, a zodiacal constellation between Aries and Aquarius.
taurus: Astronomy. the Bull, a zodiacal constellation between Gemini and Aries, containing the bright star Aldebaran.
spotless: free from any spot, stain, etc.; immaculately clean: a spotless kitchen.
balanced: being in harmonious or proper arrangement or adjustment, proportion, etc.
deformity: the quality or state of being deformed, disfigured, or misshapen.
overhung: simple past tense and past participle of overhang.
ballroom: a large room, as in a hotel or resort, with a polished floor for dancing.
hilly: full of hills; having many hills; hilly country.
jagged: having ragged notches, points, or teeth; zigzag: the jagged edge of a saw; a jagged wound.
bump: to come more or less violently in contact with; collide with; strike: His car bumped a truck.
jolt: to jar, shake, or cause to move by or as if by a sudden rough thrust; shake up roughly: The bus jolted its passengers as it went down the rocky road.
carve: to cut (a solid material) so as to form something: to carve a piece of pine.
valor: boldness or determination in facing great danger, especially in battle; heroic courage; bravery: a medal for valor.
bashful: uncomfortably diffident and easily embarrassed; shy; timid.
rend: to separate into parts with force or violence: The storm rent the ship to pieces.
raze: to tear down; demolish; level to the ground: to raze a row of old buildings.
disrepair: the condition of needing repair; an impaired or neglected state.
diploma: a document given by an educational institution conferring a degree on a person or certifying that the person has satisfactorily completed a course of study.
warship: a ship built or armed for combat purposes.
borrow: to take or obtain with the promise to return the same or an equivalent: Our neighbor borrowed my lawn mower.
minister: a person authorized to conduct religious worship; member of the clergy; pastor.
thwart: to oppose successfully; prevent from accomplishing a purpose.
anecdotal: pertaining to, resembling, or containing anecdotes: an anecdotal history of jazz.
audit: an official examination and verification of accounts and records, especially of financial accounts.
analyze: to separate (a material or abstract entity) into constituent parts or elements; determine the elements or essential features of (opposed to synthesize): to analyze an argument.
springs: a city in S Transvaal, in the E Republic of South Africa, E of Johannesburg.
mordant: sharply caustic or sarcastic, as wit or a speaker; biting.
conditioned: existing under or subject to conditions.
reflex: Physiology. noting or pertaining to an involuntary response to a stimulus, the nerve impulse from a receptor being transmitted inward to a nerve center that in turn transmits it outward to an effector.
entrust: to charge or invest with a trust or responsibility; charge with a specified office or duty involving trust: We entrusted him with our lives.
prescribe: to lay down, in writing or otherwise, as a rule or a course of action to be followed; appoint, ordain, or enjoin.
initiatory: introductory; initial: an initiatory step toward a treaty.
sacrament: Ecclesiastical. a visible sign of an inward grace, especially one of the solemn Christian rites considered to have been instituted by Jesus Christ to symbolize or confer grace: the sacraments of the Protestant churches are baptism and the Lord's Supper; the sacraments of the Roman Catholic and Greek Orthodox churches are baptism, confirmation, the Eucharist, matrimony, penance, holy orders, and extreme unction.
unreserved: not restricted; without reservation; full; entire; unqualified: unreserved approval.
perseus: Classical Mythology. a hero, the son of Zeus and Danaë, who slew the Gorgon Medusa, and afterward saved Andromeda from a sea monster.
absurd: utterly or obviously senseless, illogical, or untrue; contrary to all reason or common sense; laughably foolish or false: an absurd explanation.
incongruous: out of keeping or place; inappropriate; unbecoming: an incongruous effect; incongruous behavior.
wonderful: excellent; great; marvelous: We all had a wonderful weekend.
elsewhere: somewhere else; in or to some other place: You will have to look elsewhere for an answer.
displease: to incur the dissatisfaction, dislike, or disapproval of; offend; annoy: His reply displeased the judge.
perplexed: bewildered; puzzled: a perplexed state of mind.
unconscious: not conscious; without awareness, sensation, or cognition.
guernica: Basque town in northern Spain: bombed and destroyed in 1937 by German planes helping the insurgents in the Spanish Civil War.
reap: to cut (wheat, rye, etc.) with a sickle or other implement or a machine, as in harvest.
workroom: a room in which work is carried on.
atelier: a workshop or studio, especially of an artist, artisan, or designer.
disability: lack of adequate power, strength, or physical or mental ability; incapacity.
parks: Gordon (Alexander Buchanan) 1912–2006, U.S. photojournalist and film director.
wayside: the side of the way; land immediately adjacent to a road, highway, path, etc.; roadside.
guardian: a person who guards, protects, or preserves.
oversee: to direct (work or workers); supervise; manage: He was hired to oversee the construction crews.
oversight: an omission or error due to carelessness: My bank statement is full of oversights.
shame: the painful feeling arising from the consciousness of something dishonorable, improper, ridiculous, etc., done by oneself or another: She was overcome with shame.
ignoble: of low character, aims, etc.; mean; base: his ignoble purposes.
reputable: held in good repute; honorable; respectable; estimable: a reputable organization.
barroom: an establishment or room with a bar for the serving of alcoholic beverages.
needy: in a condition of need or want; poverty-stricken; impoverished; extremely poor; destitute.
hardware: metalware, as tools, locks, hinges, or cutlery.
corroborate: to make more certain; confirm: He corroborated my account of the accident.
confirmed: made certain as to truth, accuracy, validity, availability, etc.: confirmed reports of new fighting at the front; confirmed reservations on the three o'clock flight to Denver.
cursive: (of handwriting) in flowing strokes with the letters joined together.
expedition: an excursion, journey, or voyage made for some specific purpose, as of war or exploration.
exploration: an act or instance of exploring or investigating; examination.
stadium: a sports arena, usually oval or horseshoe-shaped, with tiers of seats for spectators.
cumulonimbus: a cloud of a class indicative of thunderstorm conditions, characterized by large, dense towers that often reach altitudes of 30,000 feet (9000 meters) or more, cumuliform except for their tops, which appear fibrous because of the presence of ice crystals: occurs as a single cloud or as a group with merged bases and separate tops.
tuneful: full of melody; melodious: tuneful compositions.
predisposition: the fact or condition of being predisposed: a predisposition to think optimistically.
inviting: attractive, alluring, or tempting: an inviting offer.
fascination: the power or action of fascinating.
applaud: to clap the hands as an expression of approval, appreciation, acclamation, etc.: They applauded wildly at the end of the opera.
appeal: an earnest request for aid, support, sympathy, mercy, etc.; entreaty; petition; plea.
provoke: to anger, enrage, exasperate, or vex.
pugilist: a person who fights with the fists; a boxer, usually a professional.
banker: a person employed by a bank, especially as an executive or other official.
invade: to enter forcefully as an enemy; go into with hostile intent: Germany invaded Poland in 1939.
limitation: a limiting condition; restrictive weakness; lack of capacity; inability or handicap: He knows his limitations as a writer.
compliance: the act of conforming, acquiescing, or yielding.
ares: the ancient Greek god of war, a son of Zeus and Hera, identified by the Romans with Mars.
disapprove: to think (something) wrong or reprehensible; censure or condemn in opinion.
condemn: to express an unfavorable or adverse judgment on; indicate strong disapproval of; censure.
amendment: the act of amending or the state of being amended.
trifolium: any leguminous plant of the temperate genus Trifolium, having leaves divided into three leaflets and dense heads of small white, yellow, red, or purple flowers: includes the clovers and trefoils
trifoliolate: having three leaflets, as a compound leaf.
provender: dry food, as hay or oats, for livestock or other domestic animals; fodder.
insure: to guarantee against loss or harm.
contingency: dependence on chance or on the fulfillment of a condition; uncertainty; fortuitousness: Nothing was left to contingency.
disable: to make unable or unfit; weaken or destroy the capability of; incapacitate: The detective successfully disabled the bomb. He was disabled by the accident.
proportioned: adjusted to proper proportion or relation.
pelvis: the basinlike cavity in the lower part of the trunk of many vertebrates, formed in humans by the innominate bones, sacrum, etc.
talus: the uppermost bone of the proximal row of bones of the tarsus; anklebone.
hip: the projecting part of each side of the body formed by the side of the pelvis and the upper part of the femur and the flesh covering them; haunch.
finance: the management of revenues; the conduct or transaction of money matters generally, especially those affecting the public, as in the fields of banking and investment.
hurry: to move, proceed, or act with haste (often followed by up): Hurry, or we'll be late. Hurry up, it's starting to rain.
outdo: to surpass in execution or performance: The cook outdid himself last night.
vie: to strive in competition or rivalry with another; contend for superiority: Swimmers from many nations were vying for the title.
salicylic: of or derived from salicylic acid.
anti: a person who is opposed to a particular practice, party, policy, action, etc.
headache: a pain located in the head, as over the eyes, at the temples, or at the base of the skull.
rheumatism: any disorder of the extremities or back, characterized by pain and stiffness.
gout: an acute, recurrent disease characterized by painful inflammation of the joints, chiefly those in the feet and hands, and especially in the great toe, and by an excess of uric acid in the blood.
neuralgia: sharp and paroxysmal pain along the course of a nerve.
alkaloid: any of a large class of organic, nitrogen-containing ring compounds of vegetable origin and sometimes synthesized, some of which are liquid but most of which are solid, that have a bitter taste, that are usually water-insoluble and alcohol-soluble, that combine with acids without the loss of a water molecule to form water-soluble hydrochlorides, hydrobromides, or the like, and that usually exhibit pharmacological action, as nicotine, morphine, or quinine.
cinchona: any of several trees or shrubs of the genus Cinchona, of the madder family, especially C. calisaya, native to the Andes, cultivated there and in Java and India for its bark, which yields quinine and other alkaloids.
malaria: Pathology. any of a group of diseases, usually intermittent or remittent, characterized by attacks of chills, fever, and sweating: formerly supposed to be due to swamp exhalations but now known to be caused by a parasitic protozoan, which is transferred to the human bloodstream by a mosquito of the genus Anopheles and which occupies and destroys red blood cells.
artemisia: any of several composite plants of the genus Artemisia, having aromatic foliage and small disk flowers, including the sagebrush, wormwood, and mugwort.
aloe: any chiefly African shrub belonging to the genus Aloe, of the lily family, certain species of which yield a fiber.
hearth: the floor of a fireplace, usually of stone, brick, etc., often extending a short distance into a room.
sauce: any preparation, usually liquid or semiliquid, eaten as a gravy or as a relish accompanying food.
corrupt: guilty of dishonest practices, as bribery; lacking integrity; crooked: a corrupt judge.
perverted: Pathology. changed to or being of an unnatural or abnormal kind: a perverted interest in death.
dissolute: indifferent to moral restraints; given to immoral or improper conduct; licentious; dissipated.
immunity: the state of being immune from or insusceptible to a particular disease or the like.
malevolent: wishing evil or harm to another or others; showing ill will; ill-disposed; malicious: His failures made him malevolent toward those who were successful.
venomous: (of an animal) having a gland or glands for secreting venom; able to inflict a poisoned bite, sting, or wound: a venomous snake.
idle: not working or active; unemployed; doing nothing: idle workers.
rumor: a story or statement in general circulation without confirmation or certainty as to facts: a rumor of war.
endless: having or seeming to have no end, limit, or conclusion; boundless; infinite; interminable; incessant: an endless series of complaints; Time is endless.
hollywood: the NW part of Los Angeles, Calif.: center of the American motion-picture industry.
grievance: a wrong considered as grounds for complaint, or something believed to cause distress: Inequitable taxation is the chief grievance.
pester: to bother persistently with petty annoyances; trouble: Don't pester me with your trivial problems.
disappointed: depressed or discouraged by the failure of one's hopes or expectations: a disappointed suitor.
announcer: a person who announces, especially one who introduces programs, presents news items, reads advertisements, and does other similar assignments over radio or television.
quote: to repeat (a passage, phrase, etc.) from a book, speech, or the like, as by way of authority, illustration, etc.
jury: a group of persons sworn to render a verdict or true answer on a question or questions officially submitted to them.
gallon: a common unit of capacity in English-speaking countries, equal to four quarts, the U.S. standard gallon being equal to 231 cubic inches (3.7853 liters), and the British imperial gallon to 277.42 cubic inches (4.546 liters). Abbreviation:  gal.
liter: a unit of capacity redefined in 1964 by a reduction of 28 parts in a million to be exactly equal to one cubic decimeter. It is equivalent to 1.0567 U.S. liquid quarts and is equal to the volume of one kilogram of distilled water at 4°C. Abbreviation:  l.
spar: Nautical. a stout pole such as those used for masts, etc.; a mast, yard, boom, gaff, or the like.
floating: being buoyed up on water or other liquid.
rig: It is the mark of a desperate party trying to rig the election results to stay in power for as long as it can.
discord: lack of concord or harmony between persons or things: marital discord.
peremptory: leaving no opportunity for denial or refusal; imperative: a peremptory command.
lodged: (of a deer or the like) represented as lying down: a stag lodged.
astray: out of the right way; off the correct or known road, path, or route: Despite specific instructions, they went astray and got lost.
monk: (in Christianity) a man who has withdrawn from the world for religious reasons, especially as a member of an order of cenobites living according to a particular rule and under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.
forge: to form by heating and hammering; beat into shape.
fraud: deceit, trickery, sharp practice, or breach of confidence, perpetrated for profit or to gain some unfair or dishonest advantage.
dishonest: not honest; disposed to lie, cheat, or steal; not worthy of trust or belief: a dishonest person.
nickname: a name added to or substituted for the proper name of a person, place, etc., as in affection, ridicule, or familiarity: He has always loathed his nickname of “Whizzer.”.
square: a rectangle having all four sides of equal length.
archbishopric: the see, diocese, or office of an archbishop.
trudge: to walk, especially laboriously or wearily: to trudge up a long flight of steps.
raven: any of several large, corvine birds having lustrous, black plumage and a loud, harsh call, especially Corvus corax, of the New and Old Worlds.
regiment: Military. a unit of ground forces, consisting of two or more battalions or battle groups, a headquarters unit, and certain supporting units.
yearn: to have an earnest or strong desire; long: to yearn for a quiet vacation.
covet: to desire wrongfully, inordinately, or without due regard for the rights of others: to covet another's property.
refraction: Physics. the change of direction of a ray of light, sound, heat, or the like, in passing obliquely from one medium into another in which its wave velocity is different.
rust: Also called iron rust. the red or orange coating that forms on the surface of iron when exposed to air and moisture, consisting chiefly of ferric hydroxide and ferric oxide formed by oxidation.
jobber: a wholesale merchant, especially one selling to retailers.
consumer: a person or thing that consumes.
rowel: a small wheel with radiating points, forming the extremity of a spur.
sane: free from mental derangement; having a sound, healthy mind: a sane person.
integration: an act or instance of combining into an integral whole.
craze: to derange or impair the mind of; make insane: He was crazed by jealousy.
soccer: a form of football played between two teams of 11 players, in which the ball may be advanced by kicking or by bouncing it off any part of the body but the arms and hands, except in the case of the goalkeepers, who may use their hands to catch, carry, throw, or stop the ball.
holiness: the quality or state of being holy; sanctity.
temple: an edifice or place dedicated to the service or worship of a deity or deities.
aphrodite: the ancient Greek goddess of love and beauty, identified by the Romans with Venus.
drum: a musical percussion instrument consisting of a hollow, usually cylindrical, body covered at one or both ends with a tightly stretched membrane, or head, which is struck with the hand, a stick, or a pair of sticks, and typically produces a booming, tapping, or hollow sound.
communion: communion practices vary by denomination and even by individual parishes.
wrathful: very angry; ireful; full of wrath: They trembled before the wrathful queen.
dragon: a mythical monster generally represented as a huge, winged reptile with crested head and enormous claws and teeth, and often spouting fire.
insignia: a badge or distinguishing mark of office or honor: a military insignia.
garter: Also called, British, sock suspender, suspender. an article of clothing for holding up a stocking or sock, usually an elastic band around the leg or an elastic strap hanging from a girdle or other undergarment.
charles: (Prince of Edinburgh and of Wales) born 1948, heir apparent to the throne of Great Britain (son of Elizabeth II).
pasha: a title, placed after the name, formerly held by high officials in countries under Turkish rule.
administrator: a person who manages or has a talent for managing.
master: a person with the ability or power to use, control, or dispose of something: a master of six languages; to be master of one's fate.
nobility: the noble class or the body of nobles in a country.
destiny: something that is to happen or has happened to a particular person or thing; lot or fortune.
epistle: a letter, especially a formal or didactic one; written communication.
module: a separable component, frequently one that is interchangeable with others, for assembly into units of differing size, complexity, or function.
modulus: Physics. a coefficient pertaining to a physical property.
council: an assembly of persons summoned or convened for consultation, deliberation, or advice.
deliberative: having the function of deliberating, as a legislative assembly: a deliberative body.
legislative: having the function of making laws: a legislative body.
chase: to pursue in order to seize, overtake, etc.: The police officer chased the thief.
jeweler: a person who designs, makes, sells, or repairs jewelry, watches, etc.; a person who deals in jewels.
revival: restoration to life, consciousness, vigor, strength, etc.
overtake: to catch up with in traveling or pursuit; draw even with: By taking a cab to the next town, we managed to overtake and board the train.
digestive: serving for or pertaining to digestion; having the function of digesting food: the digestive tract.
abatement: the act or state of abating or the state of being abated; reduction; decrease; alleviation; mitigation.
focal: of or relating to a focus.
infield: He fouls off two pitches then drives one to the grass just past the infield.
bat: Scientists think both of these related viruses originated in the bat family.
boccie: an Italian variety of lawn bowling played on a dirt court that is shorter and narrower than the rink of a bowling green.
ninepins: (used with a singular verb) tenpins played without the head pin.
tenpins: (used with a singular verb) a form of bowling, played with ten wooden pins at which a ball is bowled to knock them down.
greco: José  [hoh-zey;; Spanish haw-se]  /hoʊˈzeɪ;; Spanish hɔˈsɛ/  (Show IPA), 1918–2001, U.S. dancer and choreographer, born in Italy.
feast: any rich or abundant meal: The steak dinner was a feast.
pertinent: pertaining or relating directly and significantly to the matter at hand; relevant: pertinent details.
refresh: to provide new vigor and energy by rest, food, etc. (often used reflexively).
spirituous: containing, of the nature of, or pertaining to alcohol; alcoholic.
distill: to subject to a process of vaporization and subsequent condensation, as for purification or concentration.
mashed: mashed potatoes: The pork chop comes with string beans and mashed.
diuretic: increasing the volume of the urine excreted, as by a medicinal substance.
sorghum: a cereal grass, Sorghum bicolor (or S. vulgare), having broad, cornlike leaves and a tall, pithy stem bearing the grain in a dense terminal cluster.
aged: having lived or existed long; of advanced age; old: an aged man; an aged tree.
peach: the subacid, juicy, drupaceous fruit of a tree, Prunus persica, of the rose family.
plum: the drupaceous fruit of any of several trees belonging to the genus Prunus, of the rose family, having an oblong stone.
tonic: a medicine that invigorates or strengthens: a tonic of sulphur and molasses.
desirous: having or characterized by desire; desiring: desirous of high political office.
avarice: insatiable greed for riches; inordinate, miserly desire to gain and hoard wealth.
covetous: inordinately or wrongly desirous of wealth or possessions; greedy.
cunning: skill employed in a shrewd or sly manner, as in deceiving; craftiness; guile.
wily: full of, marked by, or proceeding from wiles; crafty; cunning.
phalanx: (in ancient Greece) a group of heavily armed infantry formed in ranks and files close and deep, with shields joined and long spears overlapping.
glycerol: a colorless, odorless, syrupy, sweet liquid, C 3 H 8 O 3 , usually obtained by the saponification of natural fats and oils: used for sweetening and preserving food, in the manufacture of cosmetics, perfumes, inks, and certain glues and cements, as a solvent and automobile antifreeze, and in medicine in suppositories and skin emollients.
dynamite: a high explosive, originally consisting of nitroglycerin mixed with an absorbent substance, now with ammonium nitrate usually replacing the nitroglycerin.
vasodilator: a nerve or drug that causes vasodilatation.
angina: any attack of painful spasms characterized by sensations of choking or suffocating.
mucus: a viscous, slimy mixture of mucins, water, electrolytes, epithelial cells, and leukocytes that is secreted by glands lining the nasal, esophageal, and other body cavities and serves primarily to protect and lubricate surfaces.
benzoin: Also called gum benjamin, gum benzoin. a reddish-brown, aromatic balsamic resin occurring in almondlike fragments and having a vanillalike odor, obtained from trees of the genus Styrax, especially S. benzoin, of Java, Sumatra, etc.: used in the manufacture of perfume and cosmetics and in medicine internally as an expectorant and externally as an antiseptic.
trigger: a small projecting tongue in a firearm that, when pressed by the finger, actuates the mechanism that discharges the weapon.
trap: a contrivance used for catching game or other animals, as a mechanical device that springs shut suddenly.
miner: Also called mineworker. a person who works in a mine, especially a commercial mine producing coal or metallic ores.
bluff: good-naturedly direct, blunt, or frank; heartily outspoken: a big, bluff, generous man.
exemplify: to show or illustrate by example.
procession: the act of moving along or proceeding in orderly succession or in a formal and ceremonious manner, as a line of people, animals, vehicles, etc.
festive: pertaining to or suitable for a feast or festival: festive decorations; a festive meal.
chon: Also, jun. a monetary unit of North Korea, the hundredth part of a won.
spoon: a utensil for use in eating, stirring, measuring, ladling, etc., consisting of a small, shallow bowl with a handle.
bounty: a premium or reward, especially one offered by a government: There was a bounty on his head. Some states offer a bounty for dead coyotes.
plenty: a full or abundant supply or amount: There is plenty of time.
therefore: in consequence of that; as a result; consequently: I think; therefore I am.
cheap: costing very little; relatively low in price; inexpensive: a cheap dress.
plunder: to rob of goods or valuables by open force, as in war, hostile raids, brigandage, etc.: to plunder a town.
cape: a sleeveless garment of various lengths, fastened around the neck and falling loosely from the shoulders, worn separately or attached to a coat or other outer garment.
kudu: a large African antelope, Tragelaphus strepsiceros, the male of which has large corkscrewlike horns.
tame: changed from the wild or savage state; domesticated: a tame bear.
straighten: to make or become straight in direction, form, position, character, conduct, condition, etc. (often followed by up or out).
cube: a solid bounded by six equal squares, the angle between any two adjacent faces being a right angle.
elephant: either of two large, five-toed pachyderms of the family Elephantidae, characterized by a long, prehensile trunk formed of the nose and upper lip, including Loxodonta africana (African elephant) with enormous flapping ears, two fingerlike projections at the end of the trunk, and ivory tusks, and Elephas maximus (Indian elephant) with smaller ears, one projection at the end of the trunk, and ivory tusks almost exclusively in males: L. africana is threatened; E. maximus is endangered.
walrus: a large marine mammal, Odobenus nosmarus, of arctic seas, related to the seals, and having flippers, a pair of large tusks, and a tough, wrinkled skin.
halogen: any of the electronegative elements, fluorine, chlorine, iodine, bromine, and astatine, that form binary salts by direct union with metals.
brine: water saturated or strongly impregnated with salt.
glycol: Also called ethylene glycol, ethylene alcohol. a colorless, sweet liquid, C 2 H 6 O 2 , used chiefly as an automobile antifreeze and as a solvent.
pepper: a pungent condiment obtained from various plants of the genus Piper, especially from the dried berries, used whole or ground, of the tropical climbing shrub P. nigrum.
cinnamon: the aromatic inner bark of any of several East Indian trees belonging to the genus Cinnamonum, of the laurel family, especially the bark of C. zeylanicum (Ceylon cinnamon) used as a spice, or that of C. loureirii (Saigon cinnamon) used in medicine as a cordial and carminative.
diplomacy: the conduct by government officials of negotiations and other relations between nations.
onset: a beginning or start: the onset of winter.
attest: to bear witness to; certify; declare to be correct, true, or genuine; declare the truth of, in words or writing, especially affirm in an official capacity: to attest the truth of a statement.
sclerosis: Pathology. a hardening or induration of a tissue or part, or an increase of connective tissue or the like at the expense of more active tissue.
indent: to form deep recesses in: The sea indents the coast.
belt: a band of flexible material, as leather or cord, for encircling the waist.
radius: a straight line extending from the center of a circle or sphere to the circumference or surface: The radius of a circle is half the diameter.
flashlight: Also called, especially British, torch. a small, portable electric lamp powered by dry batteries, LEDs, or a tiny generator.
professedly: allegedly; pretendedly: He is only professedly poor.
inappropriate: not appropriate; not proper or suitable: an inappropriate dress for the occasion.
unbecoming: detracting from one's appearance, character, or reputation; unattractive or unseemly: an unbecoming hat; unbecoming language.
loathsome: causing feelings of loathing; disgusting; revolting; repulsive: a loathsome skin disease.
noisome: offensive or disgusting, as an odor.
dirt: any foul or filthy substance, as mud, grime, dust, or excrement.
laundry: articles of clothing, linens, etc., that have been or are to be washed.
autocrat: an absolute ruler, especially a monarch who holds and exercises the powers of government as by inherent right, not subject to restrictions.
autocracy: government in which one person has uncontrolled or unlimited authority over others; the government or power of an absolute monarch.
trick: a crafty or underhanded device, maneuver, stratagem, or the like, intended to deceive or cheat; artifice; ruse; wile.
lutheran: of or relating to Luther, adhering to his doctrines, or belonging to one of the Protestant churches that bear his name.
lend: to grant the use of (something) on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned.
bosporus: a strait connecting the Black Sea and the Sea of Marmara. 18 miles (29 km) long.
marmara: Sea of, a sea in NW Turkey, between European and Asian Turkey, connected with the Black Sea by the Bosporus, and with the Aegean by the Dardanelles. 4300 sq. mi. (11,135 sq. km).
mesozoic: noting or pertaining to an era occurring between 230 and 65 million years ago, characterized by the appearance of flowering plants and by the appearance and extinction of dinosaurs.
era: a period of time marked by distinctive character, events, etc.: The use of steam for power marked the beginning of an era.
vacation: a period of suspension of work, study, or other activity, usually used for rest, recreation, or travel; recess or holiday: Schoolchildren are on vacation now.
susceptibility: state or character of being susceptible: susceptibility to disease.
opportunistic: adhering to a policy of opportunism; practicing opportunism.
pneumocystis: any protozoan of the genus Pneumocystis, esp P. carinii, which is a cause of pneumonia in people whose immune defences have been lowered by drugs or a disease
candidiasis: any of a variety of infections caused by fungi of the genus Candida, occurring most often in the mouth, respiratory tract (bronchocandidiasis) or vagina.
sarcoma: any of various malignant tumors composed of neoplastic cells resembling embryonic connective tissue.
retrovirus: any of a family of single-stranded RNA viruses having a helical envelope and containing an enzyme that allows for a reversal of genetic transcription, from RNA to DNA rather than the usual DNA to RNA, the newly transcribed viral DNA being incorporated into the host cell's DNA strand for the production of new RNA retroviruses: the family includes the AIDS virus and certain oncogene-carrying viruses implicated in various cancers.
hypodermic: characterized by the introduction of medicine or drugs under the skin: hypodermic injection.
conceit: an excessively favorable opinion of one's own ability, importance, wit, etc.
insincere: not sincere; not honest in the expression of actual feeling; hypocritical.
spurious: not genuine, authentic, or true; not from the claimed, pretended, or proper source; counterfeit.
hoax: something intended to deceive or defraud: The Piltdown man was a scientific hoax.
vanity: excessive pride in one's appearance, qualities, abilities, achievements, etc.; character or quality of being vain; conceit: Failure to be elected was a great blow to his vanity.
egotism: excessive and objectionable reference to oneself in conversation or writing; conceit; boastfulness.
inconsiderate: without due regard for the rights or feelings of others: It was inconsiderate of him to keep us waiting.
tactless: lacking tact; showing no tact; undiplomatic; offendingly blunt: a tactless remark.
itemize: to state by items; give the particulars of; list the individual units or parts of: to itemize an account.
deputy: a person appointed or authorized to act as a substitute for another or others.
disorderly: characterized by disorder; irregular; untidy; confused: a disorderly desk.
riotous: (of an act) characterized by or of the nature of rioting or a disturbance of the peace.
overturn: to destroy the power of; overthrow; defeat; vanquish.
pitcher: a container, usually with a handle and spout or lip, for holding and pouring liquids.
fluster: to put into a state of agitated confusion: His constant criticism flustered me.
inter: to place (a dead body) in a grave or tomb; bury.
donna: (initial capital letter) Madam; Lady: an Italian title of respect prefixed to the given name of a woman.
discomfort: an absence of comfort or ease; uneasiness, hardship, or mild pain.
perturb: to disturb or disquiet greatly in mind; agitate.
climber: a person or thing that climbs.
thief: a person who steals, especially secretly or without open force; one guilty of theft or larceny.
leafy: having, abounding in, or covered with leaves or foliage: the leafy woods.
review: a critical article or report, as in a periodical, on a book, play, recital, or the like; critique; evaluation.
omnipresent: present everywhere at the same time: the omnipresent God.
asexual: New York magazine art critic Jerry Saltz described it as “fabulously complex, sexual, asexual, mysterious, powerful, impish.”
chemosynthesis: the synthesis of organic compounds within an organism, with chemical reactions providing the energy source.
schizomycete: any of numerous microorganisms of the subkingdom (or phylum) Schizophyta, kingdom Monera, comprising the bacteria.
anaerobic: (of an organism or tissue) living in the absence of air or free oxygen.
trout: Compare brown trout, cutthroat trout, rainbow trout.
spasmodic: pertaining to or of the nature of a spasm; characterized by spasms.
cassava: any of several tropical American plants belonging to the genus Manihot, of the spurge family, as M. esculenta (bitter cassava) and M. dulcis (sweet cassava) cultivated for their tuberous roots, which yield important food products.
flake: a small, flat, thin piece, especially one that has been or become detached from a larger piece or mass: flakes of old paint.
fry: to cook in a pan or on a griddle over direct heat, usually in fat or oil.
frenzy: extreme mental agitation; wild excitement or derangement.
excrescence: an abnormal outgrowth, usually harmless, on an animal or vegetable body.
barb: a point or pointed part projecting backward from a main point, as of a fishhook or arrowhead.
fork: an instrument having two or more prongs or tines, for holding, lifting, etc., as an implement for handling food or any of various agricultural tools.
jab: to poke, or thrust abruptly or sharply, as with the end or point of a stick.
whales: Bay of, an inlet of the Ross Sea, in Antarctica: location of Little America.
sumptuous: entailing great expense, as from choice materials, fine work, etc.; costly: a sumptuous residence.
showy: making an imposing display: showy flowers.
couch: a piece of furniture for seating from two to four people, typically in the form of a bench with a back, sometimes having an armrest at one or each end, and partly or wholly upholstered and often fitted with springs, tailored cushions, skirts, etc.; sofa.
append: to add as a supplement, accessory, or appendix; subjoin: to append a note to a letter.
infringe: to commit a breach or infraction of; violate or transgress: to infringe a copyright; to infringe a rule.
wickedness: the quality or state of being wicked.
rarely: on rare occasions; infrequently; seldom: I'm rarely late for appointments.
regal: of or relating to a king; royal: the regal power.
grandeur: the quality or state of being impressive or awesome: the grandeur of the Rocky Mountains.
chartres: a city in and the capital of Eure-et-Loir, in N France, SW of Paris: cathedral.
ally: to unite formally, as by treaty, league, marriage, or the like (usually followed by with or to): Russia allied itself to France.
walkway: any passage for walking, especially one connecting the various areas of a ship, factory, park, etc.
roadway: the land over which a road is built; a road together with the land at its edge.
respire: to inhale and exhale air for the purpose of maintaining life; breathe.
presidency: the office, function, or term of office of a president.
treasure: wealth or riches stored or accumulated, especially in the form of precious metals, money, jewels, or plate.
treasury: a place where the funds of the government, of a corporation, or the like are deposited, kept, and disbursed.
genius: an exceptional natural capacity of intellect, especially as shown in creative and original work in science, art, music, etc.: the genius of Mozart.
bowstring: the string of an archer's bow.
hawser: a heavy rope for mooring or towing.
